programme.title: NOVA
programme.desc: A research mission to the Antarctica explores what may be behind the plummeting population of the krill, a transparent, shrimp-like creature that's an important cog in the Antarctic ecosystem. Since the 1970s, the krill numbers have declined, though no one knows why. One theory: the krill's life cycle is linked to the seasonal increase and decline of the Antarctic ice pack, which has been altered by climate change.

programme.sub-title: All the News That's Fit to Click

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny helps pursue two escaped convicts because he helped wrongfully imprison one of them. Meanwhile, Gormley is critical of a plan submitted by a sergeant who may be having an affair with Gormley's wife.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Jamie is investigated by Internal Affairs for possible police brutality caught on camera during an anti-policy demonstration. The investigation then becomes linked to Danny and Baez's rape case involving a civil rights attorney.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The last remaining Mustang from the film \"Bullitt\" is stolen, so Danny and Baez investigate. Elsewhere, Erin clashes with Frank when she sides with her boss on a matter involving cops being held accountable for fixing traffic tickets.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A serial killer threatens Danny and his family, and the ordeal heightens Linda's concern about Danny's job and the state of their marriage. Meanwhile, Jamie challenges his superior officer during a hostage situation.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A homicide case is reassigned to Erin after it results in a hung jury, and she and an ADA investigator try to track down a missing witness. Elsewhere, Jamie and Eddie pose as senior citizens in order rid a neighborhood of a troublemaking gang.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny gets interrogated about his ex-partner, who's been accused of planting evidence in order to close a murder case. Elsewhere, Frank contemplates the parameters of free speech when activists plan to burn the American flag.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A tell-all book is planned by Frank's first partner, and it causes Frank concern. Meanwhile, Jamie's and Eddie's actions affect their professional and private lives when they respond to a call about an officer needing assistance.

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Several women admit to murdering a man they worked for, and Danny must pinpoint the real killer. Meanwhile, Frank and his priest clash over how to deal with a boy who's a thief; and Nicky and her friends are arrested after drugs are found in their car.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin's plagued with guilt after a cop is killed and the main suspect is a man she recently freed. Meanwhile, Danny and Baez try to figure out why a police officer has gone AWOL; and Frank and Mayor Poole continue playing games with Frank's reappointment.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Linda's coworker needs help dealing with her enraged ex, so Linda turns to Danny and Baez. Elsewhere, Erin's unsure what to do about her old mentor, whose recent judicial sentences have been unfair; and Frank confronts a displeased City Council Speaker.

El niño va a correr el mismo destino que su padre, pero el asesino no puede cumplir la orden y lo entrega a una humilde familia para ser criado. Veinte años pasan y Efe se ha convertido en un pescador que no puede recordar nada de su pasado. Por otro lado, su hermano gemelo está al mando de la compañía de su padre y está casado con Nisan, el amor de infancia de Efe.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. The desk jockeys reflect on a day of beach competitions. Meanwhile, a corporate-job opening sparks competition at Dunder-Mifflin as Michael, Jim and Karen journey to New York for interviews. Back in Scranton, Dwight's reign of power results in extensive reforms.

programme.title: GOATs: The Greatest of All Time
programme.desc: Part 1 of 3. Celebrating athletic greats through the work of sports photographer Walter Iooss. The series begins with a look at the fates that pushed each GOAT to play their respective sports, plus their doubts about whether they could actually turn pro. Iooss is also featured as he gets his start in a rough and tumble field.

programme.title: GOATs: The Greatest of All Time
programme.desc: Part 2 of 3. The GOATS become champions, and confront the double-edged sword of fame. Also featured is photographer Walter Iooss fighting the access barricades of top sporting events, then scoring big by photographing Michael Jordan behind the scenes for a year, culminating in the bestselling photo book \"Rare Air.\".

programme.title: GOATs: The Greatest of All Time
programme.desc: The GOATS reflect on their sports, and the meaning of their careers, mixing pride with loss. Photographer Walter Iooss caps his own career with the last shoot of Ali and Frazier, and an ultimate night with the GOATs of the 20th Century posing together.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1997: Mississippi at Mississippi State in the 94th edition of the \"Battle for the Golden Egg.\" The Rebels edged State 15-14.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2005: Ohio State at Michigan. QB Troy Smith threw for 300 yards as the Buckeyes earned a share of the Big Ten title with a 25-21 win in Ann Arbor. It was OSU's fourth win in the rvials' last five meetings.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1991: Florida State at Florida. The Gators edged their intrastate rivals, downing FSU 14-9 in Gainesville.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2009: Notre Dame at Stanford. The Cardinal won 45-38, with Toby Gerhart running for 205 yards and 3 TDs, and passing for another.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2010: Northwestern at Minnesota. The Wildcats won 29-28, with Dan Persa throwing for 309 yards and 2 TDs.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2000: Northwestern at Minnesota. The Wildcats stunned Minnesota 41-35 on a 45-yard Hail Mary touchdown on the final play. Damien Anderson rushed for 230 yards and two scores for Northwestern.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2010: Michigan at Indiana. The Wolverines won 42-35, with Denard Robinson running for 217 yards.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1981: Clemson at South Carolina. The Tigers beat their state rival 29-13 to conclude their first perfect regular season since 1948.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2000: South Carolina at Clemson. The Tigers got by their cross-state rivals 16-14 on Aaron Hunt's FG with seven seconds left. Carolina's Derek Watson rushed for 148 yards, including a 61-yard scoring run.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1996: South Carolina at Clemson. The Gamecocks edged Clemson 22-21 on Mike Hold's last-second TD run and finished the season with a school-best 10-1 record.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1984: Clemson at South Carolina. The second-ranked Tigers rolled to a 29-13 win as Chuck McSwain rushed for 151 yards and two touchdowns.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1997: Georgia at Georgia Tech. The visiting Bulldogs edged Tech 27-24 in Atlanta.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1999: Georgia at Georgia Tech. The Yellow Jackets edged Georgia 51-48 in overtime. Joe Hamilton threw for 341 yards and 4 TDs for the winners, while Quincy Carter had 345 yards and 3 TDs through the air.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2009: Georgia at Georgia Tech. The Bulldogs beat Tech 30-24, rushing for 339 yards in the win.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2011: Georgia at Georgia Tech. The Bulldogs overpowered triple-option-running Tech, 31-17, as Aaron Murray tossed 4 TDs, adding to his UGa single-season record.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Georgia Tech at Georgia. The Bulldogs edged Tech 18-17 on Kanon Parkman's 34-yard FG with 47 seconds left.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1981: Ohio State at Michigan. The Buckeyes upset Michigan 14-9 when Art Schlichter scored on a six-yard run with 2:50 left in the game. It was his final regular-season appearance for the Buckeyes.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1987: Ohio State at Michigan in a Big Ten battle. The Buckeyes downed Michigan 23-20 in Earle Bruce's final game as OSU head coach.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1977: Ohio State at Michigan in a Big Ten showdown. The Wolverines got by State 14-6 in Ann Arbor.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1997: Ohio State at Michigan in a Big Ten thriller. The top-ranked Wolverines got by fourth-ranked State 20-14 behind a strong performance by Charles Woodson.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1979: Ohio State at Michigan. The Buckeyes edged Michigan, 18-15.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1969: Ohio State at Michigan. The Wolverines beat OSU 24-12 in Bo Schembechler's first \"Big Game.\" The loss snapped a 22-game winning streak for the Buckeyes.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: Michigan vs. Washington State in the 1998 Rose Bowl. The Wolverines knocked off State 21-16 and earned a share of the national title.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2012: South Carolina at Clemson. Jadeveon Clowney led the pursuit of QB Tahj Boyd and Clemson as the Gamecocks chased a fourth-straight win in the Palmetto State rivalry.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2011: Notre Dame at Stanford. The Cardinal won 28-14, with Andrew Luck throwing 4 TDs to set new career and season records at Stanford.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2009: Notre Dame at Stanford. The Cardinal won 45-38, with Toby Gerhart running for 205 yards and 3 TDs, and passing for another.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Ohio State at Michigan. The Wolverines upset second-ranked OSU 31-23 behind Tim Biakabutuka's 313 rushing yards.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2003: Ohio State at Michigan. The Wolverines earned a Rose Bowl bid with a 35-21 victory.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Florida State at Florida. The third-ranked Gators downed their state rival 35-24 in Gainesville.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Florida State vs. Florida in the Sugar Bowl in New Orleans. The Seminoles downed Florida 23-17 despite Danny Wuerffel's record 394 yards passing.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1993: Florida State at Florida. The Seminoles outscored Florida 33-21. Charlie Ward threw for 446 yards, including a 79-yard TD pass to Warrick Dunn with 5:28 to play.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2004: Florida at Florida State. The Gators won 20-13 giving Ron Zook his first win on 'Noles turf. Chris Leak threw for 231 yards and a touchdown.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2006: Florida at Florida State. The Gators beat FSU 21-14, with Chris Leak tossing 2 TD passes.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1996: Florida at Florida State. The Seminoles upset top-ranked Florida 24-21 in Tallahassee.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Chefs who just met are forced to pair up and compete against other teams of perfect strangers for a shot at big money. First, teams serve up a fried feast using only ingredients that begin with the letter \"F.\" Next, the duos create a fine dining dinner on a bare-bones budget. The surviving team must decide if they want to split $10,000 as friends, or compete against each other as foes in one last winner-take-all challenge worth $20,000.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy throws back to the meals of childhood. First, the chefs update a classic dish in a retro re-dux using limited ingredients. Then, the chefs choose which ingredients they want to feature in their regional retro dish from Guy's sample tables. Finally, the remaining two chefs decide what kind of dish they will make with the help of Guy's retro refrigerator magnets. In the end, only one chef will go on to shop Flavortown for up to $20,000.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy gives the chefs 45 minutes to make three courses in each round. First, they do all the shopping for their full meal in miniature-sized carts.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: In honor of Carl The Cuban Ruiz's love for hijinks, Guy invites six Flavortown judges to join him for April Fools' Day pranks as they remember The Cuban's funniest GGG moments.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy Fieri brings four chefs to Flavortown for a culinary competition all about eggs.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: It's shrimp season in Charleston. Kardea Brown makes fried shrimp baskets and her mom helps out with her famous hand cut fries and a fresh grilled shrimp cobb salad.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea cooks for a date night that ends with a rich Chocolate Cheesecake.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea Brown invites a friend over to sit by the creek, share a great meal and watch the world go by. Her menu includes a seafood salad roll with Charleston shrimp and blue crab, homemade seasoned chips and creekside custard cups.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea Brown whips up a brunch with a spicy twist. Pat comes over for her favorite inspired by New Orleans.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: Marcela Valladolid celebrates spring by making a savory roasted rack of lamb; and Geoffrey Zakarian toasts the season with a refreshing rhubarb lemonade. Also: new and natural techniques for decorating Easter eggs and making food-inspired bouquets; carrot cake trifle made with store-bought cake mix; and chef James Briscione's vegetable salad.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: Perfecting poultry for spring, starting with Katie Lee's roast chicken with a twist and the kickoff of the Rotisserie Club with Jeff Mauro's pulled chicken sandwich. Then, chef and restaurateur John Seymour stops by to grill honey-garlic chicken thighs; and the Kitchen Helpline answers frequently asked chicken questions. Finally, Geoffrey Zakarian serves up a mint julep.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: The crew prepares fresh and festive dishes for spring. Some recipes include: grilled lamb chops with an orange chutney; roasted carrots with honey and mint; and orecchiette with asparagus and peas.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: The chefs are encouraged to embrace beautiful imperfections as they work with so-called ugly ingredients. In the appetizer round, they find often-discarded seafood and misshapen veggies in the baskets. A perilous-looking fish presents a fierce challenge in the entree round. The last ugly turn is the dessert round, which has the chefs working with an overly baked item.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: A certain fun food is wrapped in bacon in the appetizer round; pork and noodle entrées are presented to the judges; and one of the final chefs goes bold when making dessert.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: A priest, a nun-in-training, a rabbi, and a pastor compete. In the first round, one of the cooks shocks the judges by admitting they have never worked with the basket ingredient of salmon—or for that matter any fish— before. Later, fruit and wine must be incorporated into entrée dishes; and yummy fig desserts represent the heritages of the two finalists.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Farm-fresh ingredients are featured in the baskets. Included: Appetizers are prepared with poultry and pickled chilies; the judges are eager to eat three lamb entrées, but worry fresh greens might be forgotten; and the finalists make some odd choices in the dessert round.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Dumplings are the theme for this competition, as the chefs are instructed to make stuffed morsels of dough inspired by any part of the world. A flavorful pork product and a Japanese condiment are part of the first mystery basket—and nerves and timing take a toll. Meat-and-potato dumpling entrées are in order for Round 2. And the two chefs left to cook dessert dumplings must marry some spicy chips with a tropical fruit.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: In this special competition, the baskets are filled with comfort foods. The chefs are expected to carry out the comfort theme onto their completed plates.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: The chefs find a classic Asian food in an innovative form during the first round. Next, a tough cut of meat and a container full of an unusual mayonnaise product test the chefs' creativity in round two. Ultimately, something madeofsugarybreakfast cereal invigorates the competition in the finalround.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Judge Martha Stewart tastes a corn dog for the first time; the competitors work with lamb and pie; in the final round, an unusual coffee drink and a special citrus ingredient prompt the chefs to bring some distinct flavors to the plate.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Four chefs who did not make it in high-stakes tournaments return in search of redemption. The competitors face goat chop appetizers in the first round. A breakfast cereal is the crunchy curveball in the entree basket.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: The chefs take on a melted cheese theme with the hope of giving the judges stretchable, craveworthy dishes. A platter of comfort food yumminess is at the center of a decadent first basket, and the ultimate melty cheese dish -- fondue -- finds its way into the second basket. In the dessert round, the remaining chefs have to get creative with the strange, colorful cheese snacks in the basket.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Four chefs who did not make it in high-stakes tournaments return in search of redemption. The competitors face goat chop appetizers in the first round. A breakfast cereal is the crunchy curveball in the entree basket.

In the dessert round, the remaining chefs have to get creative with the strange, colorful cheese snacks in the basket.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Judge Martha Stewart tastes a corn dog for the first time; the competitors work with lamb and pie; in the final round, an unusual coffee drink and a special citrus ingredient prompt the chefs to bring some distinct flavors to the plate.

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: The junior chefs encounter unusual surprises in every basket. A swamp special must be combined with a spicy frozen dessert in the appetizer round. Peppers and puffer fish tails are in the entrée basket. Finally, the kid chefs get a Scandinavian pancake for a dessert round challenge. Food Network Star finalist Martita Jara guest judges with chefs Marcus Samuelsson and George Mendes.

programme.title: Girl Meets Farm
programme.desc: Molly Yeh puts her own spin on some of her favorite dishes to make a fun meal for Nick and her dad. The menu includes Molly's Chicago dog meatloaf with mustard glaze, a salt-and-vinegar potato galette and wedge salads with bacon and feta cream. She rounds the meal out with her dad's favorite coconut cream pie.

programme.title: Girl Meets Farm
programme.desc: It's date night on the farm. Molly Yeh makes a romantic dinner for husband Nick, including juicy steak salad with a bright za'atar chimichurri; cheesy garlic babka muffins; and blood orange amaretto sours.

programme.title: Girl Meets Farm
programme.desc: Molly Yeh kicks off the first official Yeh-Hagen Family Games with a delicious bang. She makes Carnitas Walking Tacos and Mexican Street Corn-Loaded Tots, and for dessert, Coconut Mango Pops and ooey-gooey S'mores Brownies.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Easter is celebrated on the ranch with hot cross buns, tortellini primavera, crudités with a spinach dip and crispy eggs.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree uses tequila when cooking a meal. Recipes include queso fundido con tequila; shrimp-tortilla soup; berries with tequila cream; and a spicy Tequila Sunrise cocktail.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: The Way Things Used to Be
programme.desc: Ladd and his father feed cattle on the ranch, while sharing stories about the old days and looking forward to a slap-up cowboy spread prepared by Ree Drummond, who mixes up a fabulous PW Steak Rub to sprinkle over juicy Breakfast Steaks. Then, on the side, there's cheesy Breakfast Grits with bacon and spicy jalapenos. There's also a pan of sticky sweetness in the form of Ree's mom's classic Apple Dumplings.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Eating with the family after hauling hay in high summer. Recipes include strawberry cherry lemon limeade; orange bars; and a great make-ahead dinner on the go with slow cooker lasagna and Missy's marinated tomatoes.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond cooks super easy eats with her kids, starting with a fabulous foursome of Wafflewiches: Turkey Bacon, Reuben, Roast Beef and Fluffernutter. Plus, Ree makes Shortcut Homemade Ravioli, a stunning Blackberry Icebox Cake and an Omelet in a Mug.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Home Sweet Home: Just For Two
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes recipes just for two. For sharing, there's a juicy Cajun T-Bone Steak with Lemon Pepper Shoestring Fries. She also makes a sheet pan dinner of Spicy Peanut Chicken and Broccoli, plus Dulce de Leche Lava Cakes.

Their extravagance includes a private Eddie Money concert at Doug's house. Also, Carrie is offered a job to work for the head of the law firm. Pruzan: Alex Skuby. Kaplan: Victor Raider-Wexler. Waitress: Amy Stiller.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Arthur visits a psychiatrist (William Hurt) and recalls via flashback a disturbing encounter with his dad (Ben Stiller) that may explain Arthur's abrasive personality. programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug learns his dentist (Tim Matheson) used to have a crush on Carrie, which might explain why the root canal he performs on Doug hurts so badly. programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.title: The King of Queens

Mike: Michael Lowry. Debi: Marcia Cross. Policeman: Joe Sabatino. Policewoman: Lacie Harmon.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug serves Carrie after-work cocktails to relax her so she will be less likely to complain when he strays from his diet, but neighbor Lou Ferrigno becomes concerned for her. Danny: Gary Valentine. Carrie: Leah Remini. Arthur: Jerry Stiller.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug tries to persuade Carrie to stop wearing her hair in a bun so she will look sexier at his upcoming high-school reunion, but she refuses. Holly: Nicole Sullivan. Dave: Benjamin John Parrillo. Jimmy: Jon Curry. Miss Mancini: Lisa Long. Miss Berman: Angee Hughes.

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Microsoft's Bill Gates guest stars on Frasier's 2000th radio broadcast, an event clouded by a flap over a missing tape of an earlier show. Tom: Adam Arkin. Bulldog: Dan Butler. Noel: Patrick Kerr. Kenny: Tom McGowan.

programme.desc: Barbra Jean sets Reba up on a blind date with a gentleman from church; Van and Cheyenne butt heads over money matters after Van purchases a car without consulting his wife first. Terry: Leslie Jordan.

programme.title: Reba

programme.title: Reba

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Barbra Jean decides that having another child might improve her marriage to Brock and she enlists Reba's help in announcing her plan. But it's Brock who may have come to a more important conclusion. Elsewhere, Van and Cheyenne go apartment-hunting.

programme.desc: A gangster (Mickey Rooney) charms Sophia into driving him to the bank, where he makes a speedy and substantial withdrawal. Estelle Getty, Betty White. Dorothy: Beatrice Arthur. Blanche: Rue McClanahan.

programme.desc: Rose tries to instill some life into a recently retired friend (George Coe); and a garage-remodeling project goes nowhere fast. Vicenzo: Vito Scotti. Ernie: Don Woodard.

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates: Cults
programme.desc: The Word of Life Church starts as a small bible study group led by Pastor Jerry Irwin. After his death, his daughter Tiffanie gains control and makes life hell for the church followers, leading to the brutal death of a teenaged boy.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: An older woman (Colleen Camp) who has spent the last six months caring for her dying husband (Meat Loaf) collapses from respiratory failure, and her condition only worsens in the hospital. But her husband's condition begins to improve.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House reluctantly takes the case of an environmental activist who collapsed at a protest demonstration, and the doc assigns much of the work on it to Cameron, who had urged him to take the case in the first place. Meanwhile, House has doubts about Wilson's healthy new diet.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A deaf 14-year-old says he heard explosions just before collapsing during a school wrestling match. When his condition worsens, his mother (Clare Carey) won't allow cochlear implants. Meanwhile, House's insomnia is playing tricks with his mind, but that doesn't seem to bother him.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Wade, Sebastian and Danny are taken hostage in the morgue when an armed man bursts in and demands the remains of a petty officer, who is thought to have died from natural causes.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy commander's car is stolen with his baby inside. The NCIS team investigate to determine whether it was a random carjacking or a targeted abduction.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: LaSalle's brother, Cade, turns to NCIS for help when he finds his girlfriend's body in the trunk of his car. He claims to have no memory of the night before, but a mountain of evidence implicates him in the crime. The case is under the jurisdiction of Capt Jim Messier and Jefferson Parish, but that doesn't stop LaSalle from trying to prove his brother is innocent.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.sub-title: How Much Pain Can You Take
programme.desc: Baitfish murders someone close to the NCIS team, in order to send a message to Pride, which prompts a citywide manhunt for the elusive criminal.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Season 1 ends with the search for a mole among the ranks as NCIS and local law enforcement track the Broussard Syndicate after new intelligence suggests a breach at the ports.

programme.title: Charmed

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Prue is targeted by a sleep researcher known as the dream sorcerer (Matt Schulze), who kills women who spurn him by invading their dreams; Piper and Phoebe cast a love spell. Hans: Tim Herzog. Prue: Shannen Doherty. Piper: Holly Marie Combs.

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica throws her support behind Walter Mondale in 1984's presidential election and tries to get Beverly to vote with her, but to no avail. Meanwhile, Barry is determined to get on an athletic game show to prove his prowess after losing a wrestling match.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Neela's faced with crippling claustrophobia while trapped in a hyperbaric chamber with a baby suffering from carbon-monoxide poisoning. programme.title: ER

Lawson: Paul Blackthorne. Welling: James Leo Ryan.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Carter's efforts to push Neela trigger a crisis that threatens not only a head injury, but also a fellow doc. Gallant: Sharif Atkins. Directed by Paul McCrane.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The lungs of a ballerina (Jamie Tisdale) collapse while she's on stage, and her initial treatment causes her skin to fall off. Meanwhile, House not only still can't sleep, but he remains haunted by visions of Amber (Anne Dudek).

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Season 5 finale: The team must deal with a patient (Ashton Holmes) whose brain is at war with itself (left side vs. right side). Meanwhile, House refuses yet again to work in the clinic, so Cuddy foists an unusual patient (Carl Reiner) on him. Amber: Anne Dudek.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. House is detoxing at a mental hospital and being held against his will by his attending physician (Andre Braugher), so he concocts an escape plan, aided by his roommate (Lin-Manuel Miranda) and a visitor named Lydia (Franka Potente).

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Conclusion. House tries to escape from the mental hospital where he is being held captive by his attending physician (Andre Braugher). He plans to free himself with the help of his roommate (Lin-Manuel Miranda) and a visitor named Lydia (Franka Potente).

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House leaves the hospital and tells Cuddy that he's making major changes in his life. At the hospital, Foreman wants House's job but is having trouble with a case involving a video-game designer who posts his symptoms on the Internet, and takes treatment suggestions offered by online correspondents over those offered by the team. This development upsets Foreman and threatens his relationship with Thirteen. Dr. Darryl Nolan: Andre Braugher.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: An ailing African dictator (James Earl Jones) charged with crimes against humanity arrives at the hospital for treatment. Meanwhile, Wilson wants to end a feud with a neighbor, but a prying House gets in the way.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A teen (Tanner Maguire) has unexplained stomach pain, and his rich father (Lee Tergesen) believes that the cause is karmic payback for his business success. Meanwhile, Foreman and Chase prepare to present information on a patient they have been treating.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: In the Season 2 premiere, a military convoy is bombed on a bridge, and the team plan an undercover operation to retrieve a stolen missile in order to thwart an attack on a U.S. Naval ship.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a blogger known for exposing government corruption and discovers a dark secret about a joint Navy and CIA humanitarian mission in Bolivia.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team must determine if human error or technical malfunction led to the death of a combat pilot who crashed in a high-tech jet that had just been approved to be deployed to military bases on a global scale.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a Navy drone pilot who acquired military surveillance footage using a black market drone.

Elgin: James Earl. Abby: Maura Tierney.

Ray: Shane West. Neela: Parminder Nagra. Abby: Maura Tierney.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: An Iraqi-war vet hits a nerve with Carter, who picks up an old, ugly habit; Neela's choice to quit medicine brings her furious folks to town; Abby gets off to a rough start with the nursing staff; and Ray (Shane West) gets to strut his stuff after a man is rushed in wearing a shark. programme.title: House
programme.desc: A hard-living police detective doesn't have any symptoms of heart disease, but that's what killed his father, grandfather and great-grandfather---all at age 40. Meanwhile, the African-dictator case still haunts Chase; and House faces ghosts of his own.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A partying teen brought to the hospital with swollen appendages won't---then can't---tell the truth. Meanwhile, House tags along as Cuddy and Wilson attend a medical conference on pharmacology and public policy. Lucas: Michael Weston.

programme.desc: House resumes his post after getting his license back and sets out to form a \"dream team.\" He also treats a porn star (Troy Garity) suffering from eye pain. Meanwhile, Cuddy learns again that the hospital is no place to form healthy relationships.

programme.title: House

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Q and Murr test their parental instincts by reading their daughters' diaries, then give presentations that are anything but normal. The big loser gets painfully honest with bodybuilders at the gym.

programme.title: People Like Us
programme.desc: Businessman Sam returns home for his father's funeral, where he learns he has a sister named Frankie. As Sam connects with Frankie and puts his father's affairs in order, he is forced to reflect on his own life choices in this riveting comedy-drama.

programme.title: Inheritance
programme.desc: After a politically influential hedge fund tycoon dies, his daughter inherits a strange cabin. She discovers that it is home to a stranger whom her father imprisoned for three decades and who possesses shocking secrets that can undermine her father's legacy and compromise the positions of her mother and brother.

programme.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
programme.desc: Matt Damon, Jude Law and Gwyneth Paltrow star in this chilling adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's novel about a social-climbing psychopath. Damon is superb as Tom Ripley, a charming mimic whose obsession with a wealthy playboy (Law) turns deadly. Cate Blanchett, Philip Seymour Hoffman. Directed by Anthony Minghella.

programme.title: Rounders
programme.desc: Matt Damon plays a law student whose poker skills create a dilemma of choice between pursuing the law and the excitement of testing himself against the best in the world of underground high-stakes games. The scales are tipped toward the latter when the young man must aid a jailbird pal (Edward Norton) in debt to mobsters. Gretchen Mol, John Turturro, Famke Janssen, John Malkovich, Martin Landau.

programme.title: Mississippi Burning
programme.desc: A fictionalized account of the FBI's investigation into the 1964 disappearance of three civil-rights workers in the South.

programme.title: Blackhat (?)
programme.desc: A furloughed convict and his partners hunt a high-level cybercrime network.

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword
programme.desc: Arthur draws Excalibur from the stone in this visually stunning retelling of the legend. Later, he must learn to harness its power in order to lead a rebellion against his uncle Vortigern, who murdered Arthur's father and usurped the throne years ago.

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: A nouveau riche bachelor buys his way into 1920s Long Island society in order to win back his obsession, a woman from his past who is now married to \"old money.\".

programme.title: The Hoax
programme.desc: Richard Gere is a fascinating portrait in brazen panache as disgraced author and con artist Clifford Irving, who tricked the public in the early 1970s by claiming to have written an \"authorized\" biography of eccentric billionaire Howard Hughes. Marcia Gay Harden is excellent as Irving's misguided wife, and Alfred Molina gives a captivating performance as the author's right-hand man, who's fully aware that Irving has something up his sleeve. Directed by Lasse Hallstrom. Julie Delpy, Hope Davis.

programme.title: Idlewild
programme.desc: OutKast's André Benjamin and Antwan A. Patton (aka André 3000 and Big Boi) rock the house in this electrifying tale of a piano player and the manager of a 1930s southern speakeasy. Paula Patton, Terrence Howard, Faizon Love, Malinda Williams. Written and directed by Bryan Barber.

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: Exciting car chases and frenetic martial-arts action fortify this action-packed crime thriller from writer-producer Luc Besson. Jason Statham stars as Frank Martin, a deliveryman of illicit packages who gets mixed up in an Asian slave ring. Shu Qi, Matt Schulze, Ric Young, Francois Berleand.

programme.title: I Love You Phillip Morris
programme.desc: In this quirky comedy, cop-turned-con artist Steven Russell (Jim Carrey) ends up in jail and meets fellow inmate Phillip Morris (Ewan McGregor), who becomes the love of his life. For years, Steven plots cons in order to free both of them from prison and earn enough money so they can live comfortably on the outside.

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In this chilling horror sequel set in 1967 Los Angeles, a widow making ends meet as a psychic finds a Ouija board that enables her to talk to the dead. While it's great for business, the board also allows a ghost to possess her 9-year-old daughter.

programme.title: American Reunion
programme.desc: Jim (Jason Biggs), Michelle and the rest of the gang return to East Great Falls for their 10-year high-school reunion in this poignant comedy. Meanwhile, Finch still looks back with lust at that perfect night he spent with Stiffler's mom.

programme.title: National Lampoon's Dorm Daze 2: College @ Sea
programme.desc: Set sail for sun, fun and high times with the students of Billingsley University at a wild and sexy party aboard a cruise ship bound for Mexico.

programme.title: Let's Go to Prison
programme.desc: An ex-con takes revenge on the late judge who kept putting him away by scheming to have the man's yuppie son sent to the slammer for a little payback. Dax Shepard and Will Arnett star in this outrageous and irreverent farce. Chi McBride, David Koechner, Dylan Baker. Directed by Bob Odenkirk.

programme.title: This Means War
programme.desc: Big laughs abound when two top CIA spies find their enduring friendship put to the ultimate test when they engage in an all-out battle to win the affections of a beautiful woman after they discover they are both dating her.

programme.title: Tomcats
programme.desc: Jerry O'Connell stars in this raunchy comedy as a cartoonist in over his head with a casino bigwig (Bill Maher), a situation that forces him to rely more than ever on a friendly wager with his childhood friends. Shannon Elizabeth, Jake Busey, Horatio Sanz, Jaime Pressly.

programme.title: Flight of the Intruder
programme.desc: Vietnam saga about renegade pilots on an unauthorized bombing raid.

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: A small-town cop, tortured by a past failure as a hostage negotiator, is caught in the middle of two kidnappings in this stylish thriller.

programme.title: For Greater Glory: The True Story Of Cristiada (?)
programme.desc: This gripping historical drama follows a number of Mexicans as they become involved in the Cristero War of the 1920s.

programme.title: Papi Chulo (?)
programme.desc: A lonely, gay weatherman enlists a random, Mexican migrant laborer to work on his house, but before long the laborer is expected to accompany the weatherman on romantic excursions and date-like scenarios to fill the hole in his life, leading to comedic misunderstandings.

programme.title: The Aftermath
programme.desc: Set in postwar Germany, a woman meets her British colonel husband in war-ravaged city of Hamburg. After learning they will now live with the previous owners of the house, a German widower and his daughter, the wife must ignore temptation as she finds herself drawn towards the quiet intensity of the widower.

programme.title: In the Bedroom
programme.desc: Sissy Spacek, Tom Wilkinson and Marisa Tomei give Oscar-nominated performances in this powerful portrait of a family in crisis. Spacek and Wilkinson play a happily married Maine couple whose lives are shattered when their son is brutally murdered and the law fails to bring the killer to justice. Nick Stahl, William Mapother.

programme.title: Human Capital
programme.desc: After meeting Quint, the father of his daughter's boyfriend, Drew, a local real estate agent, decides to invest in his latest hedge fund, though through illegal means. It signals the start of many troubles for him, which is only amplified by the revelation that his wife, Ronnie, is expecting twins. When an unintentional manslaughter takes place, the complicated relations between the two families become even more tangled.

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In this harrowing historical drama set in the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days.

programme.title: Equilibrium
programme.desc: In this futuristic thriller, set in a postapocalyptic world where emotions have been outlawed, a top government enforcer entrusted with seeking and destroying offenders finds his loyalty questioned when his true feelings are exposed.

programme.title: Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter
programme.desc: President Abraham Lincoln moonlights as a vampire hunter after learning that his mother was killed by bloodsuckers in this wildly fun supernatural action thriller adapted from the genre-bending novel.

programme.title: Evil Dead 2: Dead by Dawn
programme.desc: Special effects and humor blend in a sequel about teens trapped in a haunted cabin.

programme.title: The Good Liar
programme.desc: Roy Courtnay has made a successful living as a con artist. He crosses paths with wealthy widow Betty McLeish, who seems like the perfect opportunity for an easy job. However, the deeper Roy falls into Betty's life, the deeper his emotions run for her. What he thought would be a straightforward swindle unfolds into a significantly more complicated moment in his life.

programme.title: I Think I Love My Wife
programme.desc: Chris Rock co-wrote, directed and stars in this hilarious romantic comedy about a married man whose incessant fantasies about cheating are put to the test when he runs into a friend's beautiful ex-girlfriend.

programme.title: Impostor (?)
programme.desc: Gary Sinise stars in the mind-bending director's cut of a classic story by legendary science-fiction author Philip K. Dick (\"Minority Report\"). In the year 2079, a military scientist (Sinise) desperately tries to prove his true identity after he's accused of being a booby-trapped alien spy. Vincent D'Onofrio, Madeleine Stowe, Tony Shalhoub.

programme.title: Much Ado About Nothing
programme.desc: In this modern retelling of Shakespeare's hilarious battle-of-the-sexes comedy, a bickering man and woman are tricked into falling in love as a wedding is jeopardized by malicious rumors about the bride-to-be.

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: Kurt Russell stars in this action-packed thriller about a terrorism expert whose team tries to rescue a hijacked plane carrying nerve gas. Steven Seagal, Halle Berry, John Leguizamo, Oliver Platt, Joe Morton. Stuart Baird (\"U.S. Marshals\") directed.

programme.title: Ad Astra
programme.desc: An astronaut embarks on an interstellar odyssey in search of his long-lost father. He encounters an unusual secret that could jeopardize the existence of Earth, solving mysteries integral to the fabric of mankind and humanity's role in the greater scheme of the universe.

programme.title: Orange County
programme.desc: Hollywood's next generation takes center stage as Colin Hanks (son of Tom) stars in this comedy from director Jake Kasdan (son of Lawrence). It's the story of a California high-school senior (Hanks) who jumps through hoops to get into Stanford after a mishap with his transcript. Schuyler Fisk, Jack Black, Catherine O'Hara, John Lithgow, Lily Tomlin, Chevy Chase.

programme.title: Johnny English Reborn
programme.desc: Bumbling secret agent Johnny English (Rowan Atkinson) races to save the Chinese premier from assassins after uncovering evidence of a global conspiracy in this uproariously funny sequel.

programme.title: Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Riotous and outlandish spoof of disaster flicks following a group of attractive young people looking for a safe haven while dodging a deluge of natural and unnatural calamities. Carmen Electra, Matt Lanter. Among the films targeted: \"Iron Man,\" \"The Incredible Hulk,\" \"Hancock,\" \"Enchanted,\" \"Juno,\" \"Sex and the City\" and \"Cloverfield.\" The movie also lampoons pop figures such as Amy Winehouse and Hannah Montana. Produced, written and directed by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.

programme.title: Good Boys
programme.desc: One day, 12-year-old Max gets invited by the cool kids to a kissing party. Panicked because he doesn't know how to kiss, he enlists the help of two of his friends, Thor and Lucas, to help him uncover the mystery of kissing. After online research proves to be unproductive, they decide to take the drone owned by Max's father in order to spy on the neighboring teens. When the drone unexpectedly crashes, the boys are thrust into an adventure.

programme.title: The Campaign
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy, two powerful CEOs attempt to turn a tourism-center director into a viable political candidate in order to defeat the blundering congressman of a crucial North Carolina district.

programme.title: My Week With Marilyn
programme.desc: In this poignant examination of stardom, a 23-year-old is hired to chauffeur Marilyn Monroe (Michelle Williams) for one week during the shooting of \"The Prince and the Showgirl,\" affording the young man a glimpse at the sadness behind her Hollywood persona. Based on the memoirs of British filmmaker Colin Clark.

programme.title: Margot at the Wedding
programme.desc: A cynical writer travels home to reconcile with her estranged, free-spirited sister, who is about to get married. Nicole Kidman and Jennifer Jason Leigh give superb performances in this incisive dramedy of family dysfunction. Written and directed by Noah Baumbach.

programme.title: The Hours
programme.desc: Powerhouse performances and a literate, emotionally rich script mark this Best Picture nominee. It's an Oscar-nominated adaptation of Michael Cunningham's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about three troubled women who are deeply dissatisfied with their lives: Virginia Woolf (Best Actress Nicole Kidman), a '50s housewife (Julianne Moore) and a modern-day book editor (Meryl Streep). Ed Harris, Miranda Richardson.

programme.title: Anna Karenina
programme.desc: Unhappy aristocrat Anna Karenina faces the tides of change in late-19th-century Russia and has an affair with a wealthy count in this ravishing adaptation of Leo Tolstoy's classic novel.

programme.title: The Woman in Black
programme.desc: In this chilling tale, widowed attorney Arthur Kipps (Daniel Radcliffe) is haunted by a vengeful ghost after he travels to a deceased client's secluded country home. In time, Arthur decides to investigate the ghost's intentions.

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: A band of criminals are assembled for a jewel heist by a kingpin who keeps them anonymous from each other. But when the job goes wrong, the group is left bloodied and panicked, wondering who among them is the rat.

programme.title: Fade to Black
programme.desc: Rapper Jay-Z, one of the best in the business, headlines this excellent concert recorded in New York City's Madison Square Garden in November 2003. The film also features interviews with Jay-Z and his producers in a Los Angeles studio, and on-stage performances by Beyonce, Mary J. Blige, Foxy Brown, Ghostface Killah, Missy Elliott, ?uestlove and R. Kelly.

programme.title: Bulletproof Monk
programme.desc: An ageless monk guards a sacred scroll that can grant its readers the power to rule the world. With the help of a cocky pickpocket, the monk battles a Nazi who's trying to seize control of the artifact.

programme.title: RAD
programme.desc: Director Hal Needham pulls up lame in this tale of a teen (Bill Allen) in a rigged bike race. Mrs. Jones: Talia Shire. Timmer: Ray Walston. Christian: Lori Loughlin. Bart Taylor: Bart Conner.

programme.title: Without a Paddle
programme.desc: Three pals answer the call of the wild in this raucous, fish-out-of-water comedy.

programme.title: The Great Outdoors
programme.desc: An obnoxious loudmouth ruins his mild-mannered brother-in-law's summer vacation by barging in on his remote mountain cabin getaway.

programme.title: Loosies
programme.desc: In this charming romantic comedy, New York pickpocket Bobby (Peter Facinelli) reevaluates his life after he learns he will soon become a father.

programme.title: Sniper
programme.desc: Two soldiers – a veteran who knows the terrain, and an outranking, though inexperienced, marksman with no confirmed kills – team up to extinguish a guerilla leader in the jungles of Panama.

programme.title: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Richard Pryor as a con man who avoids jail by impersonating a doctor. Rachel: Rachel Ticotin. Louis: Ruben Blades. Foster: Bob Dishy. Chambers: Joe Mantegna. Stucky: Joe Dallesandro. Maggie: Sylvia Miles.

programme.title: Salvation Boulevard
programme.desc: A Christian named Carl (Greg Kinnear) falls under the spell of magnetic mega-church preacher Dan Day, but he soon witnesses Dan committing a shocking crime against an atheist author. Meanwhile, Carl is torn between his old life as a Grateful Dead fan and his new life as a man of God.

programme.title: Peace, Love & Misunderstanding
programme.desc: This affectionate comedy follows a conservative lawyer who reunites with her hippie mother in an attempt to escape her marital woes back in New York.

programme.title: The Great Outdoors
programme.desc: An obnoxious loudmouth ruins his mild-mannered brother-in-law's summer vacation by barging in on his remote mountain cabin getaway.

programme.title: Without a Paddle
programme.desc: Three pals answer the call of the wild in this raucous, fish-out-of-water comedy.

programme.title: Sinister
programme.desc: A true-crime novelist moves into a house that was once the site of a multiple murder, and he soon encounters a deadly supernatural entity in this exciting horror tale.

programme.title: Seed of Chucky
programme.desc: Chucky the maniacal doll returns in this witty horror yarn, the fifth outing in the film series. This time, Chucky (voice of Brad Dourif) and his bride (voice of Jennifer Tilly) are brought back to life by their gentle offspring (voice of Billy Boyd). The murderous couple go on a killing spree in Hollywood, terrorizing actress Jennifer Tilly (who plays herself) in the process. Redman.

programme.title: Croupier
programme.desc: Mike Hodges, director of 1971's \"Get Carter\" with Michael Caine, gambled and won with this acclaimed caper film. Clive Owen stars as Jack Manfred, a struggling author and London casino worker. Jack rolls the dice with a seductress (Alex Kingston), whose associates plan to rip off his employers. Gina McKee, Kate Hardie, Nicholas Ball.

programme.title: Loosies
programme.desc: In this charming romantic comedy, New York pickpocket Bobby (Peter Facinelli) reevaluates his life after he learns he will soon become a father.

programme.title: Blackout
programme.desc: Two strangers are about to witness the death of the Sun. This short film takes place in the approximate eight minutes it takes for light to reach Earth from the Sun, as two strangers, Sampson and Darryl, discuss what they wish they could have done differently had they not taken sunlight for granted.

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: Helen Mirren's Oscar-winning portrayal of Britain's Queen Elizabeth II propels this sharply intelligent reimagining of the royalty's response to the death of Princess Diana in 1997.

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: Wildly inventive dark comedy about a puppeteer who gains access to John Malkovich's brain via a small portal in his office. Later, a love triangle forms when he and his wife both have affairs with one of his coworkers while inhabiting Malkovich's body.

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: Chris Rock directed, co-wrote and stars in this hilarious farce about an obscure politician whose campaign for president surprisingly gains momentum. He plays Mays Gilliam, a dedicated D.C. alderman, who astonishes his detractors when his folksy campaign catches fire.

programme.title: The Iron Lady
programme.desc: Meryl Streep stars in this gripping biopic of influential prime minister Margaret Thatcher, the woman who led the United Kingdom through the 1980s. Directed by Phyllida Lloyd.

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: Helen Mirren's Oscar-winning portrayal of Britain's Queen Elizabeth II propels this sharply intelligent reimagining of the royalty's response to the death of Princess Diana in 1997.

programme.title: Last Night
programme.desc: While a man is away on a business trip, his wife (Keira Knightley) considers cheating on him with an old flame in this intimate drama. Meanwhile, he finds himself drawn to a sultry new coworker. Directed by Massy Tadjedin.

programme.title: Shuttlecock
programme.desc: At the memorial for his WWII-hero father, a middle-aged John Prentis reveals a dark family secret to his own son. Hidden for more than two decades, the revelation forces the two to confront their own fraught relationship and the complexities of their family's past.

programme.title: The Cold Light of Day
programme.desc: A hotshot stockbroker must save his family after they are kidnapped during a vacation in Spain. In order to do so, he will need to learn dark secrets from his father's past and uncover a government conspiracy.

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: When a murderer is killed in a police shoot-out, he invokes a voodoo spell that allows him to transfer his spirit into a doll.

programme.title: Child's Play 2
programme.desc: Demonic doll Chucky, who is possessed by the soul of a serial killer, tries to kidnap the boy who previously owned him in order to perform a voodoo ritual that will allow him to possess the youngster's body.

programme.title: Child's Play 3
programme.desc: The serial killer possessed doll stalks his friend 'til the end Andy as he enrolls in a military academy. With a brand new body, Chucky sets his sights on another young recruit with whom he can play hide-the-soul.

programme.title: Bride of Chucky
programme.desc: The homicidal doll from the \"Child's Play\" series is brought back to life by his human ex-girlfriend (Jennifer Tilly), who becomes a doll herself. Reunited, the two set out in search of a magical talisman that will return them to human form, venting their murderous urges along the way. Alexis Arquette, John Ritter, Katherine Heigl, Nick Stabile.

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: This ode to jazz focuses on Bleek Gilliam, a self-absorbed, contemporary trumpet player whose blind devotion to his own talent causes rifts in his professional and personal lives.

programme.title: I Got the Hook Up
programme.desc: Master P and A.J. Johnson star in this comic tale of two inner-city con artists who acquire a shipment of expensive cell phones. Soon everyone in the 'hood is using their stolen merchandise to reach out and touch someone, attracting unwanted attention from the phone company, the FBI and the local crime boss. Gretchen Palmer, Tommy 'Tiny' Lister Jr., Anthony Boswell, Helen Martin, John Witherspoon. Written by Master P.

programme.title: The Cold Light of Day
programme.desc: A hotshot stockbroker must save his family after they are kidnapped during a vacation in Spain. In order to do so, he will need to learn dark secrets from his father's past and uncover a government conspiracy.

programme.title: Rudy
programme.desc: A diminutive underdog is obsessed with joining Notre Dame's football team. Based on actual events.

programme.title: Shark Night
programme.desc: In this clever shocker, vacationing college student Sara (Sara Paxton) and her friends fight for their lives against man-eating sharks during a trip to her family's island cabin.

programme.title: Hit!
programme.desc: Effective action yarn with Billy Dee Williams leading a vigilante group after drug pushers. Mike: Richard Pryor. Strong: Paul Hampton. Sherry: Gwen Welles. Schiller: Warren Kemmerling. Ida: Janet Brandt. Herman: Sid Melton. Carlin: David Hall. Crosby: Todd Martin. Director: Normann Burton. Mme. Frelou: Jenny Astruc. Romain: Yves Barsacq. Directed by Sidney J. Furie.

programme.title: Winter Solstice
programme.desc: Anthony LaPaglia is superb as a grieving widower who struggles to deal with his youngest son's self-destructive behavior and his oldest son's decision to leave home. Josh Sternfeld wrote and directed this poignant family drama. Aaron Stanford, Mark Webber, Allison Janney.

programme.title: Liberal Arts
programme.desc: In this poignant, heartwarming tale, a thirtysomething man dealing with a midlife crisis visits his old college campus at the behest of a former professor, and unexpectedly falls for a sophomore who reawakens his sense of purpose.

programme.title: Margot at the Wedding
programme.desc: A cynical writer travels home to reconcile with her estranged, free-spirited sister, who is about to get married. Nicole Kidman and Jennifer Jason Leigh give superb performances in this incisive dramedy of family dysfunction. Written and directed by Noah Baumbach.

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: A girl literally comes of age in this pleasing comedy, a well-received female variation on 1988's \"Big.\" In 1987, an awkward 13-year-old girl's wish to skip adolescence is magically granted when she wakes up as a 30-year-old in 2004. Trying to adjust to her adult body and the new era, she seeks out a childhood friend for help.

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: A sharpshooting FBI agent goes undercover as a surfer to stop a crime wave. The criminals wear rubber masks of former U.S. presidents when robbing banks.

programme.title: Snow White and the Huntsman
programme.desc: In this rousing take on the classic tale, an evil queen orders the death of Snow White, who is being trained in the art of war by a huntsman. Meanwhile, a prince becomes enthralled by Snow White's beauty and strength.

programme.title: Blade Runner 2049
programme.desc: In this stunning sci-fi sequel, a cop known as K hunts down android laborers who have gone rogue. But when he uncovers a conspiracy involving the robots, K searches for the one person who might have answers: a law-enforcement agent who once had his job.

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: Nine Oscars---including Best Picture---went to this superb romantic WWII drama starring Ralph Fiennes. Juliette Binoche plays a compassionate nurse who takes her horribly injured, amnesiac patient (Fiennes) to a monastery to die in peace. A book the man carries reveals the story of his life before the war and explains the chain of events that brought him to his fate, including his affair with a married woman (Kristin Scott Thomas). Willem Dafoe, Naveen Andrews, Colin Firth.

programme.title: Iron Jawed Angels
programme.desc: Historical drama about Alice Paul (Hilary Swank), Lucy Burns and the fight for women's suffrage in the U.S. in the early 1900s. Frances O'Connor. Directed by Katja von Garnier.

programme.title: Bandits
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and Billy Bob Thornton are delightful as thieves who hold a bank manager hostage the night before a heist, then empty the vault before the start of business the next day---known as the \"Sleepover Bandits.\" Barry Levinson directed the sly comedy-drama. Cate Blanchett, Troy Garity.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The Crawley family prepares for an official royal visit to their family house in Yorkshire in 1927. They experience physical, social, and psychological upheavals as King George V, Queen Mary, and their royal entourage descend on the eponymous mansion.

programme.title: Life of Pi
programme.desc: In this visually stunning adventure drama, a zookeeper's son is stranded at sea aboard a lifeboat with a zebra, an orangutan, a hyena and a Bengal tiger named Richard Parker.

programme.title: City Slickers
programme.desc: Three New Yorkers sign up for a cattle drive on a western dude ranch in this comedic farce. Jack Palance won a Best Supporting Actor Oscar for his portrayal of a grizzled trail boss who leads the urban tenderfoots.

programme.title: Man on a Ledge
programme.desc: An NYPD hostage negotiator attempts to talk cop-turned-fugitive Nick Cassidy (Sam Worthington) down from a high ledge, but she learns that he may have a hidden motive for threatening to take his own life in this pulse-pounding thriller.

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Christopher Krebs; Caitlin Flanagan; Bret Stephens
programme.desc: Former Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency director Christopher Krebs is interviewed. The panelists are writers Caitlin Flanagan (Atlantic) and Bret Stephens (New York Times).

programme.title: The Invisible Man
programme.desc: A domestic abuse survivor grows convinced that her wealthy scientist ex-boyfriend has discovered a way to make himself invisible and is stalking her after faking his own death and leaving her a part of his fortune.

programme.title: The Last Cruise (?)
programme.desc: Chronicling the first and largest outbreak of the COVID-19 coronavirus outside China: The Diamond Princess cruise liner.

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding ride, a rookie CIA operative (Ryan Reynolds) goes on the run with a rogue former intelligence officer (Denzel Washington) after a South African safe house comes under attack by heavily armed mercenaries.

programme.title: The Day Sports Stood Still
programme.desc: Chronicling the events of March 11, 2020, as the reality of COVID-19 shut down sports in the U.S., beginning with the Jazz-Thunder NBA game in Oklahoma City. OKC guard Chris Paul was on the court and serves as an executive producer of the documentary, which also features NBA commissioner Adam Silver; Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban; NBA Players Association executive director Michele Roberts; Donovan Mitchell; Danilo Gallinari; and Karl-Anthony Towns.

programme.title: The Dead Don't Die
programme.desc: Unusual occurrences begin to unfold in the small and uneventful town of Centerville, from animals behaving oddly to irregular periods of daylight. However, the most unexpected event proves to be the most serious as corpses begin to leave their graves to attack the townspeople.

programme.title: The Last King of Scotland
programme.desc: This potent, powerful biopic is based on the reallife story about the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin, his troubled reign and his mercurial relationship with a Scottish doctor.

programme.title: Tolkien
programme.desc: A look at the life and literary works of the much celebrated author of modern fantasy literature J.R.R. Tolkien, who grew from a orphaned boy to one of the greatest high fantasy authors in history with his Middle-Earth novels, still popular with modern audiences today.

programme.title: The Call of The Wild
programme.desc: Buck, a St. Bernard/Scotch Collie dog, must fight tooth and claw for survival after being kidnapped from his comfortable home in California. He is forced to become a sled dog in the unforgiving wildernesss of Yukon, Canada, during the 1890 Klondike Gold Rush.

programme.title: We bought a zoo
programme.desc: Cameron Crowe cowrote and directed this quirky comedy-drama based on the true story of Benjamin Mee (Matt Damon), a discontent English widower who buys and renovates a struggling zoo. This adaptation moves the plot to the U.S., with Benjamin a distraught reporter who has a fractured relationship with his children after his wife's passing. But Benjamin and his family finally come together as they struggle to restore the dilapidated zoo.

programme.title: Rocky Balboa
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone wrote, directed and stars in this knockout sixth go-round in the ring cycle, in which the never-say-die Philadelphia palooka comes out of retirement to fight reigning champ Mason \"The Line\" Dixon.

programme.title: Coastal Elites
programme.desc: Five diverse individuals across the U.S. find different ways of coping with life during the coronavirus pandemic in 2020. Originally conceived as a play, it was adapted for the screen and filmed under quarantine guidelines.

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Edward Norton and Ben Stiller are delightful in Norton's directorial debut about a priest and a rabbi who've been friends since childhood. But when another old pal (Jenna Elfman) reunites with the men, one of them is in danger of becoming a third wheel. Eli Wallach, Anne Bancroft, Ron Rifkin, Milos Forman.

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Paul Walker puts the pedal to the metal in this high-octane sequel to 2001's \"The Fast and the Furious.\" Walker returns as Brian O'Conner, a cop skilled at street racing. This time out, he goes undercover in Miami to take down a drug magnate. The result: relentless action, kinetic street racing and gravity-defying car chases.

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: A bomber has rigged a bus with a bomb and a cop must get on-board while it is traveling to figure out how to get the passengers off.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop
programme.desc: A crack Detroit detective pursues a pal's killer through the plastic jungle of Southern California, where he tweaks authority, tumbles with the bad guys and bends the rules.

programme.title: Tina
programme.desc: This documentary provides an intimate look at the life and career of iconic American-born singer Tina Turner. It explores her early life in Brownsville, Tennessee, her unexpected rise to fame in the 1960s, the upheavals in her personal and professional life, and her unexpected career resurgence and superstardom in the 1980s.

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Riveting biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa.

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: A group of orphaned girls are taken in by a doll maker and his wife, who are still grieving the death of their daughter. However, they are soon terrorized by a haunted doll that's lurking within the couple's house in this bloodcurdling horror sequel.

programme.title: The Book of Henry
programme.desc: A young boy learns that his next-door neighbor is being abused by her stepfather, and starts writing a book about how to rescue her. When his mother discovers his plans, she decides to enact them herself in this moving drama.

programme.title: Timeline
programme.desc: Richard Donner directed this thrilling adaptation of Michael Crichton's novel about a team of modern-day archaeological students trying to rescue their mentor (Billy Connolly) from 14th-century France. Paul Walker, Frances O'Connor, Gerard Butler, David Thewlis, Anna Friel, Neal McDonough, Michael Sheen, Lambert Wilson, Matt Craven, Ethan Embry.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: In 1942, a few months after the infamous Pearl Harbor attack and a few years before World War II ended, the Japanese forces were once again planning to stage a sudden attack against their opponents this time near the Midway Atoll. Their plan, however, was intercepted, and the American forces arrived at the Pacific Ocean theater just in time to stop them. The battle lasted for three days, and its outcome became a critical turning point in the ongoing war.

programme.title: The Lucky One
programme.desc: In this unforgettable tale of romance, Iraq War veteran Logan Thibault tracks down a woman from a photo that he credits with keeping him alive during three tours of duty, and he begins to suspect that she is the love of his life.

programme.title: Drumline
programme.desc: Energetic drama about a hotshot New York City percussionist who adjusts to the demands of a big-time college marching band while trying to fit in at the prestigious Atlanta university.

programme.title: X-Men: First Class
programme.desc: Prof. Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and Magneto (Michael Fassbender) assemble a team of superpowered mutants in order to save mankind from nuclear annihilation in this action-powered comic-book prequel, which depicts the formation of the X-Men and the origins of Xavier and Magneto's ideological rivalry.

programme.title: Jojo Rabbit
programme.desc: It is the latter part of World War II, and all Jojo Betzler wants is to become a Nazi. He turns to his 10-year-old imagination and begins to befriend a wackier version of Nazi Germany's ruler, Adolf Hitler. One day, he finds out that his mother, Rosie, is housing a Jewish girl named Elsa. Despite going directly against his young beliefs, he has no choice but to keep quiet for his and his family's safety. Soon, he and his imaginary friend begin to see the world differently.

programme.title: I Used to Go Here
programme.desc: The 35-year-old novelist Kate Conklin is still reeling from the recent breakup with her fiancé. Upon the launch of her new book, she receives an invitation from her old college professor, David, to visit her alma mater and give a talk to his students. To distract her from the breakup grief, Kate accepts and rediscovers her college, but now through the eyes of the students living there.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding historical thriller set during the early days of WWII, a number of civilian boats set out to rescue 400,000 British and Allied troops trapped on the beaches of Dunkirk, France, before they are decimated by Nazi forces.

programme.title: Wrath of the Titans
programme.desc: In this riveting fantasy sequel, Perseus (Sam Worthington) ventures into the underworld in order to rescue Zeus (Liam Neeson) from the clutches of Hades (Ralph Fiennes), Ares and Kronos, who want to steal Zeus' power and subjugate humanity.

programme.title: Saw
programme.desc: A psychotic killer chains two men together and forces them to make horrific choices to win their freedom in this spellbinding thriller reminiscent of \"Seven.\" Leigh Whannell, Cary Elwes, Danny Glover, Ken Leung, Dina Meyer, Mike Butters, Paul Gutrecht.

programme.title: Saw II
programme.desc: A police detective captures the serial killer known as \"Jigsaw,\" only to learn that he has just set up a new scenario involving eight people trapped in a house full of nerve gas. This terrifying chiller is a sequel to the 2004 sleeper hit.

programme.title: Saw III
programme.desc: In this terrifying sequel, the police continue their hunt for the torture master Jigsaw, who is now terminally ill but has a crazed female apprentice to continue his sadistic games.

programme.title: 2 Dope Queens
programme.desc: Uzo Aduba discusses nerdy obsessions; Phoebe and Jessica talk about their fashion inspirations. Also: performances by comedians Naomi Ekperigin, Al Jackson and Gary Gulman.

programme.title: The Wedding Date
programme.desc: Debra Messing is absolutely engaging in this smart and witty romantic comedy as a neurotic, single New Yorker who hires a polished male escort (Dermot Mulroney) for her sister's nuptials in England after she learns that the best man is her ex-fiancé. Holland Taylor, Jeremy Sheffield, Amy Adams, Jack Davenport, Peter Egan, Sarah Parish, Jolyon James.

programme.title: Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure
programme.desc: Two dim best friends who dream of being famous rock stars time-travel in order to bring ancient figures to modern times so that they can pass a history class and graduate. If they fail, one of them will be forced to join the military.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey
programme.desc: Bill and Ted's lyrics create a utopian future, so a tyrant sends evil robot versions of the simple-minded heroes back in time to kill them. Bill and Ted end up in the afterlife, and must outsmart the Grim Reaper in order to return to the land of the living to stop their evil counterparts and save their girlfriends.

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Black
programme.desc: A recent college graduate becomes entangled in a peculiar sexual relationship with a wealthy businessman in this hilarious parody of \"Fifty Shades of Grey.\".

programme.title: The Girl With All the Gifts
programme.desc: In this engaging horror thriller set in a world overrun by zombies, a trio of soldiers, a teacher and a scientist are forced to protect a young girl whose immunity to the outbreak could be the key to saving humanity.

programme.title: X-Men: First Class
programme.desc: Prof. Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and Magneto (Michael Fassbender) assemble a team of superpowered mutants in order to save mankind from nuclear annihilation in this action-powered comic-book prequel, which depicts the formation of the X-Men and the origins of Xavier and Magneto's ideological rivalry.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Topics include Fox News host Tucker Carlson; the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021; and Oprah Winfrey's interview with Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, and Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: An army of alien spaceships attack Earth and threaten to destroy the human race, but a handful of survivors band together to stop the invasion.

programme.title: Tina
programme.desc: This documentary provides an intimate look at the life and career of iconic American-born singer Tina Turner. It explores her early life in Brownsville, Tennessee, her unexpected rise to fame in the 1960s, the upheavals in her personal and professional life, and her unexpected career resurgence and superstardom in the 1980s.

programme.title: Argo
programme.desc: In this incredible thriller based on true events, a CIA agent uses the production of a fake science-fiction movie called \"Argo\" as a cover for a rescue operation in the Middle East during the Iranian hostage crisis.

programme.title: Saw IV
programme.desc: The terrifying horror franchise continues with this latest installment revolving around an abducted cop and the hunt for a killer who is continuing the deadly legacy of Jigsaw and his protégé. Tobin Bell, Costas Mandylor, Scott Patterson, Betsy Russell, Lyriq Bent, Athena Karkanis. Directed by Darren Lynn Bousman.

programme.title: Saw V
programme.desc: The frightfully unnerving fifth entry in the popular, long-running slasher series finds serial killer Jigsaw dead (or is he?) and his sadistic successor continuing with his diabolical, torturing ways. Costas Mandylor, Tobin Bell, Julie Benz, Donnie Wahlberg, Betsy Russell, Scott Patterson, Meagan Good, Greg Bryk. Directed by David Hackl, who was the production designer on \"Saw II,\" \"Saw III\" and \"Saw IV,\" as well as second-unit director on \"Saw III\" and \"Saw IV.\".

programme.title: The Apparition
programme.desc: In this unrelenting tale of terror, a young couple are haunted by an entity that feeds on fear following a parapsychology experiment. Desperate, they turn to a noted supernatural expert for help.

programme.title: Western Stars
programme.desc: In June 2019, five years after his last musical effort, legendary musician Bruce Springsteen released his latest album entitled Western Stars. As a companion piece, he also released a full-length film with the same name, wherein he sings all the songs found on the album in his stunning and historic barn, backed by a full orchestra. To help tell the artist's and the album's story, the film provides narration from Springsteen himself, as well as archival footage.

programme.title: Wendy
programme.desc: A soft-spoken Louisiana girl journeys to an exciting, ethereal and tropical island jungle called Neverland where children never grow old. However, her whimsical, carefree behavior is soon marred by the realization of what happens when mortality descends on the young.

programme.title: Lars and the Real Girl
programme.desc: Ryan Gosling gives a bravura performance as a lonely, delusional young man named Lars who surprises his family when he shows up with a new love, a life-size doll he names Bianca and treats like an actual girlfriend. Things take an even quirkier turn when Lars' psychiatrist (Patricia Clarkson) tells his family and friends to humor him and go along with the situation. An offbeat and touching comedy-drama directed by Craig Gillespie and written by Nancy Oliver. Emily Mortimer, Paul Schneider.

programme.title: Beavis and Butt-head Do America
programme.desc: The state of the Nation will never be the same when Mike Judge's famous cartoon degenerates, Beavis and Butt-head, embark on a cross-country quest to recover their stolen TV set---and leave chaos and destruction in their wake. Voices: Mike Judge, Robert Stack, Cloris Leachman, Eric Bogosian, Sam Johnson, John Doman, Richard Linklater, Pamela Blair, Dale Reeves.

programme.title: Blade Runner 2049
programme.desc: In this stunning sci-fi sequel, a cop known as K hunts down android laborers who have gone rogue. But when he uncovers a conspiracy involving the robots, K searches for the one person who might have answers: a law-enforcement agent who once had his job.

programme.title: Rock of Ages
programme.desc: Brilliant adaptation of the off-Broadway musical about two dreamers who fall in love during the height of the hair-metal scene as they navigate the seedy world of drugs, mullets and stripping.

programme.title: The Last Cruise (?)
programme.desc: Chronicling the first and largest outbreak of the COVID-19 coronavirus outside China: The Diamond Princess cruise liner.

programme.title: Joker
programme.desc: Driven insane by the disregard shown toward him by Gotham City's inhabitants, failed stand-up comedian Arthur Fleck turns to a life of crime as the Joker. With seemingly everyone paying attention to his reign of terror, Joker soon becomes an icon of fear and, to some, inspiration.

programme.title: Irresistible
programme.desc: Gary, a political strategist, thinks that the key to converting supporters for their Democratic National Committee is backing the mayoral bid of a retired US Marine in a predominantly right-wing town in Wisconsin. But when the Republican National Committee discovers this strategy, they send in their best political strategist, Faith, who happens to be Gary's long-time nemesis in the political arena.

programme.title: Saw VI
programme.desc: In the shocking sixth entry in one of the biggest horror franchises of all time, detective Hoffman continues the work of serial killer Jigsaw by setting up fiendishly complex traps for his victims. Meanwhile, the FBI closes in and Jigsaw's grand scheme finally comes into focus.

programme.title: Saw: The Final Chapter
