programme.desc: In this terrifying installment of the hugely popular horror series, the surviving victims of Jigsaw consult a self-help guru (Sean Patrick Flanery), whose dark secrets end up causing as much carnage as the killer himself. Directed by Kevin Greutert.

programme.title: 2 Dope Queens
programme.desc: Uzo Aduba discusses nerdy obsessions; Phoebe and Jessica talk about their fashion inspirations. Also: performances by comedians Naomi Ekperigin, Al Jackson and Gary Gulman.

programme.title: The Photograph
programme.desc: The estranged daughter of a famed photographer initiates a romantic relationship with an up-and-coming journalist who is working on a story about her late mother's life and artistic legacy after discovering an old photograph in a safe-deposit box.

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Sandra Bullock returns as Annie, the spunky heroine from \"Speed,\" as she joins her new beau, Alex (Jason Patric), on an ocean liner. Unfortunately, also aboard is a madman who takes control of the ship and threatens to sink her in a plot to steal millions in jewels and seek revenge for his devastating illness. Willem Dafoe, Temuera Morrison, Brian McCardie.

programme.title: Shallow Hal
programme.desc: In this weighty farce, superficial playboy Hal Larson (Jack Black) is only interested in attractive women until a self-help guru hypnotizes him. Then, he sees only a woman's inner beauty and promptly falls for a bighearted, 300-pound woman (Gwyneth Paltrow). Bobby and Peter Farrelly directed and wrote the script. Jason Alexander, Joe Viterelli.

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: Brendan Fraser is a raider of the lost sarcophagus in this rousing, high-tech remake of the 1932 horror classic. The adventure yarn follows an expedition of treasure-seeking explorers in the Sahara Desert who unwittingly unleash a 3000-year-old mummy. Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo.

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.sub-title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel Xxxx21 - #287
programme.desc: An award-winning monthly sports journalism series with investigative pieces and in-depth profiles from across the sports spectrum.

programme.title: Fast & Furious presents: Hobbs & Shaw
programme.desc: Officer Luke Hobbs strives to uphold justice in every facet of his life. However, when a genetically altered cyber villain begins to endanger innocent citizens, Hobbs finds that he must forge an unexpected partnership with rebel Deckard Shaw to protect those they love.

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: Quentin Tarantino's highly stylized revenge saga comes to a bloody good conclusion as the Bride continues to avenge her wedding-day massacre. After eliminating one enemy after another, the stage is set for an epic showdown with her former boss and lover.

programme.title: Walk of Shame
programme.desc: In this hilariously raunchy comedy, an aspiring reporter races to an important job interview following a one-night stand that leaves her stranded in downtown Los Angeles. To make matters worse, she's been left without a phone, car, money or ID.

programme.title: The High Note
programme.desc: The overworked, overlooked, and underappreciated personal assistant to a superstar singer seizes the opportunity to revitalize her boss's languishing career - and to realize her childhood dream of becoming a music producer. Both women discover friendship and professional fulfillment amidst Los Angeles's competitive music scene.

programme.title: Tina
programme.desc: This documentary provides an intimate look at the life and career of iconic American-born singer Tina Turner. It explores her early life in Brownsville, Tennessee, her unexpected rise to fame in the 1960s, the upheavals in her personal and professional life, and her unexpected career resurgence and superstardom in the 1980s.

programme.title: Barefoot
programme.desc: In this delightful, feel-good romance, a wealthy playboy falls for a sheltered beauty who charms his family at his brother's lavish wedding. Suddenly, the man whose life was going nowhere seems to have found the road to true happiness.

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's Oscar-winning adaptation of his own novel is a poignant drama about a World War II-era orphanage in Maine, where a sensitive lad who grows up under the tutelage of the institute's kindly doctor who performs abortions on the side.

programme.title: Adventureland
programme.desc: Dejected after finding out he's no longer visiting Europe after graduating college, James takes a summer job at a small local amusement park to cover his NY grad school expenses. He falls for his co-worker Em, and together they experience love and heartbreak, and both grow over the course of the summer.

programme.title: The Dancer Upstairs
programme.desc: John Malkovich makes a smashing directorial debut in this intricately plotted drama about political corruption, murder, terrorists and obsession.

programme.title: Miss Julie
programme.desc: Over the course of a midsummer night in Fermanagh in 1890, an unsettled daughter of the Anglo-Irish aristocracy encourages her father's valet to seduce her.

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: This rip-roaring remake of the 1965 adventure classic soars thanks to stunning aerial photography and fantastic special effects. Dennis Quaid plays a pilot whose plane crashes in the Gobi Desert, where he and his crew try to reconstruct their craft and fly it to safety. The film marks the directorial debut of John Moore. Tyrese Gibson, Miranda Otto, Giovanni Ribisi, Tony Curran, Kirk Jones (a.k.a. Sticky Fingaz), Hugh Laurie, Scott Michael Campbell, Jared Padalecki, Kevork Malikyan.

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: An ancient assassin attempts to trounce an evil conqueror by teaming up with a coalition of the remaining \"free tribes\" surviving under tyrannical rule.

programme.title: Flags of Our Fathers
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood produced, directed and composed the score for this inspiring and engrossing World War II epic. It's the fact-based story of two marines and a sailor (Adam Beach, Jesse Bradford, Ryan Phillippe) who helped raise the flag over Iwo Jima and then were shipped home to help raise money for the war effort. Adapted from the book by Ron Powers and James Bradley, whose father is played by Phillippe. Steven Spielberg is one of the producers. Barry Pepper, Judith Ivey, John Benjamin Hickey.

programme.title: Don't Let Go
programme.desc: Mourning the loss of three of his family members, a detective receives a haunting phone call from his deceased niece, who is existing on an alternate timeline two weeks prior. It is now up to Jack to talk her through the coming days to save her and her family's lives in this mystery thriller.

programme.title: Unforgettable
programme.desc: In this riveting female-centric thriller, a jilted ex-wife grows jealous of her former husband's new bride, and decides to destroy the latter's reputation in an attempt to get her old life back.

programme.title: Sanctum
programme.desc: In this propulsive thriller, diver Frank McGuire (Richard Roxburgh) leads a team of underwater adventurers, including his son, into a complex series of caves, only to discover that they may be trapped when a storm cuts off their route to the surface. Produced by James Cameron.

programme.title: Dream House
programme.desc: In this white-knuckle thriller, Will discovers that his family have been targeted by a deranged killer who massacred the people who previously lived in his house. With the help of a neighbor, he tries to solve the mystery of their deaths before it's too late.

programme.title: Chronicle
programme.desc: Dane DeHaan stars in this thrilling found-footage fantasy thriller about three high-school friends who discover their untapped superpowers. But as their powers develop, so does the temptation to use them for evil.

programme.title: Fast & Furious presents: Hobbs & Shaw
programme.desc: Officer Luke Hobbs strives to uphold justice in every facet of his life. However, when a genetically altered cyber villain begins to endanger innocent citizens, Hobbs finds that he must forge an unexpected partnership with rebel Deckard Shaw to protect those they love.

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: This sparkling biopic of literary editor Max Perkins centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe. As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels, Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s.

programme.title: Dead Man Walking
programme.desc: Moving portrayal of real-life nun Helen Prejean, who develops a bond with a death-row inmate, in this powerful adaptation of Prejean's memoirs.

programme.title: A Hidden Life (?)
programme.desc: Franz Jägerstätter refuses to fight for the Nazis in World War II.

programme.title: Worth Winning
programme.desc: A self-centered TV weatherman in Philadelphia makes a wager with his friends that he can become engaged to three women they can choose within the span of three months.

programme.title: Going in Style
programme.desc: Three elderly friends and retired steelworkers are outraged to learn that their pension fund has been raided by a shady corporation. Soon, they decide to rob one of the corporation's banks to get their money back in this rousing crime comedy.

programme.title: Betsy's Wedding
programme.desc: Alan Alda wrote, directed and stars in this tale of a financially pressed father facing his daughter's impending nuptials. Madeline Kahn, Molly Ringwald, Ally Sheedy. Stevie Dee: Anthony LaPaglia. Oscar: Joe Pesci. Eddie's Father: Joey Bishop. Jake: Dylan Walsh. Gloria: Catherine O'Hara. Georgie: Burt Young.

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Renée Zellweger, Colin Firth and Hugh Grant return for this must-see sequel. Charming but insecure Bridget has finally landed the reserved Mr. Darcy (Firth), but she is concerned that their relationship won't last. Adding to her worries is the fact that her new employers have paired her with her womanizing ex-boyfriend, Daniel Cleaver (Grant).

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: An NYC condo manager (Ben Stiller) and his staff plot to rob the penthouse of a thieving Wall Street billionaire who defrauded them out of their savings in this hysterical crime comedy. But they'll need the help of a crafty thief to execute the heist.

programme.title: It: Chapter Two
programme.desc: Nearly three decades after their initial run-in with the unsettling Pennywise, the members of the Losers Club' have left their hometown, pursuing lives of their own. However, some unnerving news delivered over the phone sends each of them running back to the source of their original fright.

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: In Terry Gilliam's inventive fantasy, the famed authors are cast as con artists who get caught up in a real-life fairy tale involving a haunted forest where girls have been disappearing. Matt Damon and Heath Ledger star in this whimsical adventure. Jonathan Pryce, Monica Bellucci, Peter Stormare, Lena Headey.

programme.title: Barefoot
programme.desc: In this delightful, feel-good romance, a wealthy playboy falls for a sheltered beauty who charms his family at his brother's lavish wedding. Suddenly, the man whose life was going nowhere seems to have found the road to true happiness.

programme.title: 10 Years
programme.desc: Adults attend their 10-year high-school reunion in this memorable drama as old flames are rekindled, a repentant bully regresses, rivals compete for the affections of a popular beauty and a musician longs for the crush who inspired his hit single.

programme.title: Cruel Intentions
programme.desc: The seductive Kathryn (Sarah Michelle Gellar) poses the ultimate challenge to her charming stepbrother, Sebastian (Ryan Phillippe). If he can deflower the headmaster's virgin daughter (Reese Witherspoon), then Sebastian can have Kathryn for one night. If he fails, she gets his vintage car.

programme.title: Fierce People
programme.desc: An underprivileged teen spends the summer at the estate of a wealthy family, where he indulges in luxury but also discovers that the rich can be savage.

programme.title: Ma
programme.desc: Sue Ann, a lonely middle-aged woman, strikes up an unlikely friendship with a circle of teenagers. She offers to let them use her house as their party spot until unusual and unnerving episodes begin unfolding, causing the teens to question their host and her motives.

programme.title: Abandon
programme.desc: A bright college student is haunted by her past in this atmospheric thriller. Katie Burke is a driven senior at a prestigious college whose boyfriend, Embry, vanished years earlier. Katie's life unravels when a cop investigates the disappearance and Embry begins showing up on campus.

programme.title: All Is Lost
programme.desc: A solitary mariner struggles to survive in the Indian Ocean as his damaged sailboat begins to sink and his radio equipment fails. Later, he attempts to locate a shipping route in hopes of being rescued in this masterful tale of man versus nature.

programme.title: Get Shorty
programme.desc: A collector for the mob travels to L.A. to get a payment from a Hollywood producer, and discovers his skills in the world of organized crime translate to the movie business in this showbiz comedy. After helping a producer land a big-name actor for a script, he also helps the compromised man get out of a relationship with a powerful drug dealer.

programme.title: Sunshine Cleaning
programme.desc: A single mom struggling to make ends meet persuades her slacker sister to go into the crime-scene-cleanup business to make some quick cash. Amy Adams and Emily Blunt star in this quirky, well-acted dramedy from the producers of \"Little Miss Sunshine.\" Alan Arkin, Jason Spevack, Steve Zahn. Directed by Christine Jeffs.

programme.title: Misery
programme.desc: Angry that he killed off her hero, a woman holds her favorite novelist hostage to make him write a new book the way she wants it.

programme.title: Dark Shadows
programme.desc: Entombed for 200 years after betraying a witch, 18th-century vampire Barnabas Collins returns to his mansion in 1972, only to find his estate in ruins and his family plagued by macabre secrets in this deliciously gothic remake of the classic TV series.

programme.title: Wanderlust
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy, an unemployed Manhattan businessman and his wife move into a seemingly idyllic, clothing-optional hippie commune called Elysium, which may cause more problems in their marriage than it solves.

programme.title: Hitman (?)
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin known as Agent 47 finds himself on the run with a hooker after he is double-crossed on a mission in Russia. Timothy Olyphant and Dougray Scott star in the explosive unrated adaptation of the popular video game. Olga Kurylenko, Robert Knepper, Ulrich Thomsen. Directed by Xavier Gens.

programme.title: Surrogates
programme.desc: This dazzling, futuristic sci-fi thriller follows Greer, an FBI agent investigating a murder in a world where people no longer go outside but instead live life through robotic surrogates controlled from their homes. As Greer amasses clues, he uncovers a conspiracy involving the people responsible for creating the surrogates.

programme.title: Metro (?)
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy as a San Francisco cop who has his hands full breaking in a new partner (Michael Rapaport), controlling a gambling addiction and nailing a jewel thief. Korda: Michael Wincott. Ronnie: Carmen Ejogo. Thomas Carter directs.

programme.title: Good Boys
programme.desc: One day, 12-year-old Max gets invited by the cool kids to a kissing party. Panicked because he doesn't know how to kiss, he enlists the help of two of his friends, Thor and Lucas, to help him uncover the mystery of kissing. After online research proves to be unproductive, they decide to take the drone owned by Max's father in order to spy on the neighboring teens. When the drone unexpectedly crashes, the boys are thrust into an adventure.

programme.title: Orange County
programme.desc: Hollywood's next generation takes center stage as Colin Hanks (son of Tom) stars in this comedy from director Jake Kasdan (son of Lawrence). It's the story of a California high-school senior (Hanks) who jumps through hoops to get into Stanford after a mishap with his transcript. Schuyler Fisk, Jack Black, Catherine O'Hara, John Lithgow, Lily Tomlin, Chevy Chase.

programme.title: Dark Shadows
programme.desc: Entombed for 200 years after betraying a witch, 18th-century vampire Barnabas Collins returns to his mansion in 1972, only to find his estate in ruins and his family plagued by macabre secrets in this deliciously gothic remake of the classic TV series.

programme.title: My Super Ex-Girlfriend
programme.desc: In this high-flying comedy, Uma Thurman gives a superb performance as a shrewish, possessive superhero who gets dumped by her regular-Joe boyfriend (Luke Wilson), and then decides to use her superpowers to exact revenge on him and his new love (Anna Faris). In a hilarious nod to \"Fatal Attraction,\" Thurman substitutes live great-white-shark sushi for the boiled bunny. Directed by Ivan Reitman and written by Don Payne, who has scripted episodes of \"The Simpsons.\".

programme.title: Season of the Witch
programme.desc: In this hair-raising supernatural thriller, medieval crusader Behmen (Nicolas Cage) and his men are ordered to capture a suspected witch and bring her back to an abbey after church officials accuse her of bringing about the Black Plague.

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: In this heartwarming sports drama, Keanu Reeves plays a ne'er-do-well gambler who learns something about the game of life when he agrees to coach an inner-city Chicago Little League team. Talented kid actors pitch in to provide solid relief. Diane Lane, John Hawkes, DeWayne Warren, Michael Jordan, Michael Perkins, Julian Griffith, Bryan C. Hearne, A. Delon Ellis Jr., Brian M. Reed.

programme.title: Barbarosa
programme.desc: A hard-bitten outlaw befriends a young fugitive in 1880s Texas.

programme.title: Poltergeist II: The Other Side
programme.desc: The Freeling family is once again spooked by supernatural forces in this sequel to the 1982 blockbuster. They're back for Carol Anne, and this time the Beast takes the form of a sinister reverend.

programme.title: Sneakers
programme.desc: The Government blackmails the leader of a high-tech security group into finding a decoder, and will drop criminal charges against him if he is successful.

programme.title: Glitter
programme.desc: Pop diva Mariah Carey stars in a rags-to-riches tale similar to her own life story. In her first starring role, Carey plays Billie Frank, a woman who struggles to overcome a troubled childhood to achieve her dreams of becoming a singing star. Max Beesley, Da Brat, Tia Texada.

programme.title: Can You Keep A Secret?
programme.desc: Emma reveals her deepest secrets to the stranger sitting on the plane beside her, believing that the plane will inevitably crash due to the intense turbulence. Much to her dismay, she discovers that her seatmate is the CEO of the company she will be working with over the course of her business trip, and he knows every detail of her most embarrassing stories.

programme.title: Anna
programme.desc: A strikingly beautiful woman unleashes her strength and skills in order to become one of the best government assassins in the world. Later, she is recruited by the CIA to kill KGB's head in exchanged for immediate retirement and lifetime protection.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: When their mobster husbands are sent to prison by the FBI, three New York housewives decide to continue their husbands' business on their own, soon becoming the most powerful mobsters in 1970s Hell's Kitchen.

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: Marlon Brando, Robert De Niro and Edward Norton team up in this tense caper about the daring heist of a priceless artifact of European royalty, but bickering among the principals threatens to precipitate a coup before the theft gets under way. Frank Oz directed. Angela Bassett, Gary Farmer, Jamie Harrold, Paul Soles.

programme.title: A Walk Among the Tombstones
programme.desc: The thrills never stop when a NYC heroin trafficker hires a haunted ex-cop to find the men who abducted and killed his wife. But as the sleuth gets closer to his targets, he realizes that they're much more sinister than he could have imagined.

programme.title: John Q
programme.desc: Riveting thriller about a family man whose son needs a lifesaving heart-transplant operation. When his health-care plan doesn't cover the boy's medical procedure, he takes drastic steps to rectify the situation.

programme.title: Blindness
programme.desc: A small group of people band together to fight back when a mysterious epidemic of blindness paralyzes a city. Julianne Moore and Mark Ruffalo star in this stylish and provocative apocalyptic allegory from Fernando Meirelles, the acclaimed director of \"City of God.\" Alice Braga, Yusuke Iseya, Yoshino Kimura, Don McKellar.

programme.title: Killerman
programme.desc: Moe Diamond is a money launderer who mainly works around Manhattan's hectic jewelry circuit. After scoring a lucrative gig, he, together with his partner, Skunk, decides to make a quick one-off drug deal. Unfortunately for them, the cops catch wind of the trade and a chase ensues. Their car crashes, and the next thing Moe knows, he is in the hospital with amnesia. After Skunk gets him out, he has to expertly navigate an unfamiliar world in order to survive.

programme.title: Six Days, Seven Nights
programme.desc: In this romantic comedy, Anne Heche plays an ambitious magazine editor who becomes marooned on a deserted island with a gruff cargo pilot (Harrison Ford). Despite their conflicting personalities, the two castaways gradually fall for one another, even as they are besieged by mother nature and ruthless modern-day pirates. David Schwimmer, Jacqueline Obradors, Temuerra Morrison, Allison Janney.

programme.title: Birth of the Dragon
programme.desc: In 1964 San Francisco, a pre-fame Bruce Lee challenges a Shaolin monk named Wong Jack Man to a fight behind closed doors. This engaging drama depicts this real-life event, which helped cement Lee's reputation as a legendary martial artist.

programme.title: Bloodsport
programme.desc: A portrait of Frank Dux, the first Westerner to win the Kumite, a deadly martial-arts contest. Based on actual events.

programme.title: Surrogates
programme.desc: This dazzling, futuristic sci-fi thriller follows Greer, an FBI agent investigating a murder in a world where people no longer go outside but instead live life through robotic surrogates controlled from their homes. As Greer amasses clues, he uncovers a conspiracy involving the people responsible for creating the surrogates.

programme.title: Magnolia
programme.desc: In this audacious ensemble drama about the intersecting lives of troubled Californians, a dying mogul tries to reunite with his motivational-speaker son, a young quiz-show winner deals with his father's abuse and a drug addict falls for a lonely cop.

programme.title: Valkyrie
programme.desc: Tom Cruise stars in the incredible true story of a rebel German army officer who led a plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler and overthrow his ruthless Nazi regime during World War II. Bryan Singer (\"X-Men\") directs this suspenseful thriller. Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson.

programme.title: Apocalypse Now
programme.desc: Epic set during the Vietnam War about an American captain sent on a top-secret mission into Cambodia to assassinate a renegade Green Beret colonel the Army believes has gone insane. Based on the novel \"Heart of Darkness\" by Joseph Conrad.

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon give award-winning performances and do their own singing in this touching portrait of music legend Johnny Cash and his tumultuous love affair with June Carter. Ginnifer Goodwin, Robert Patrick, Dallas Roberts. Directed by James Mangold.

programme.title: Jersey Girl
programme.desc: Screenwriter-director Kevin Smith (\"Clerks\") ditches his profane stoners for this witty and tender comedy-drama. Ben Affleck stars as a widowed ex-publicist who returns to his humble New Jersey roots to raise his young daughter.

programme.title: Forces of Nature
programme.desc: Ben Affleck is an airplane passenger traveling to his wedding in Georgia and Sandra Bullock is the charmer seated next to him in this delightful romance. When their flight experiences trouble, they decide to find other modes of transportation. Fighting, flirting and hitching rides, they seem destined to be together---despite his impending nuptials.

programme.title: Ad Astra
programme.desc: An astronaut embarks on an interstellar odyssey in search of his long-lost father. He encounters an unusual secret that could jeopardize the existence of Earth, solving mysteries integral to the fabric of mankind and humanity's role in the greater scheme of the universe.

programme.title: Romance & Cigarettes
programme.desc: A working-class husband cheats on his wife in this irreverent and imaginative musical in which characters spontaneously break into song. Emmy Award winner James Gandolfini and Oscar winner Susan Sarandon star. John Turturro wrote and directed. Kate Winslet, Steve Buscemi, Mandy Moore, Mary-Louise Parker, Christopher Walken.

programme.title: The Watch
programme.desc: Four suburbanites stumble upon an alien invasion while volunteering as a neighborhood-watch group, and they fight to protect their block from evil extraterrestrials in this madcap sci-fi comedy.

programme.title: The Hoax
programme.desc: Richard Gere is a fascinating portrait in brazen panache as disgraced author and con artist Clifford Irving, who tricked the public in the early 1970s by claiming to have written an \"authorized\" biography of eccentric billionaire Howard Hughes. Marcia Gay Harden is excellent as Irving's misguided wife, and Alfred Molina gives a captivating performance as the author's right-hand man, who's fully aware that Irving has something up his sleeve. Directed by Lasse Hallstrom. Julie Delpy, Hope Davis.

programme.title: Dying of the Light
programme.desc: In this intense spy thriller, a CIA agent on the verge of retirement goes rogue in order to hunt down a dangerous terrorist.

programme.title: Tomcats
programme.desc: Jerry O'Connell stars in this raunchy comedy as a cartoonist in over his head with a casino bigwig (Bill Maher), a situation that forces him to rely more than ever on a friendly wager with his childhood friends. Shannon Elizabeth, Jake Busey, Horatio Sanz, Jaime Pressly.

programme.title: The Ladykillers
programme.desc: In this screamingly funny update of the 1955 classic, a gang of thieves poses as a band to plot a riverboat heist, but their elderly landlady catches on. When she refuses to stay silent for a share of the take, they decide to silence her permanently. An arch remake of the 1955 British comedy classic.

programme.title: Yesterday
programme.desc: A bus accident knocks out aspiring singer-songwriter Jack Malik. Upon waking up, he discovers that he's living in a world where The Beatles never existed. As a result, he's able to pass off their songs as his own.

programme.title: Hackers
programme.desc: High-school students stumble onto an embezzlement scheme and use computer wizardry to thwart the mastermind.

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: Sophisticated special effects abound in this sci-fi thriller about a spacecraft that fell off the map---only to reappear seven years later. A rescue team headed by Captain Miller (Laurence Fishburne) is dispatched to search for survivors, but finds only abandoned corridors... until horrifying visions lead them to the truth behind what happened to the ship's crew. Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson.

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: In this taut thriller, forensics expert Alex Cross investigates the disappearance of a senator's daughter, a student at a prestigious private academy.

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Writer-director Andrew Dominik's thoughtful, elegiac saga is a dead-on throwback to classic Westerns of yore. Brad Pitt gives a bang-up performance as the notorious outlaw living out his final days in 1882 before being gunned down by a member of his gang (Casey Affleck). Features a cameo by political pundit James Carville as Governor Crittenden and rocker Nick Cave as a saloon singer. Cave also co-wrote the score. Actor-playwright Sam Shepard costars as Jesse's brother Frank.

programme.title: VICE
programme.desc: Paola Ramos travels to El Darién along the Colombia-Panama border to meet with migrants facing robbery, rape and death on the road north; Krishna Andavolu investigates police-worn body camera functionality, usage, legislation and impact.

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Lip has a million projects going on, and Frank is one of them; Liam is forced to watch Frank, so the two of them embark on a journey to take down Liam's classmate in an effort to get Liam into STEM school; Carl's disillusionment with the police force comes to a head; Debbie embraces the next chapter of her life and hunts for a new place; Mickey and Ian toy with the idea of the West Side; Kev meets Veronica in Louisville in a last-ditch effort to convince Carol not to move.

programme.title: City on a Hill
programme.desc: When an assistant U.S. attorney overdoses and ends up left for dead, Decourcy Ward suspects Jackie Rohr's involvement. Jackie, in turn, goes after the BPD for a questionable drug arrest at Braxton Summit, a federal housing project. Community activist Grace Campbell recruits Siobhan Quays to work on behalf of Braxton and its residents, but their efforts are subverted as tensions flare between rival gangs.

programme.title: Relic
programme.desc: When Kay learns that her aging and widowed mother, Edna, has vanished, she and her daughter Sam venture to Edna's remote home in search of the truth. The women soon sense an unsettling presence lurking in the house and possessing Edna, threatening to wreak havoc on the lives of Kay's family.

programme.title: City on a Hill
programme.desc: When an assistant U.S. attorney overdoses and ends up left for dead, Decourcy Ward suspects Jackie Rohr's involvement. Jackie, in turn, goes after the BPD for a questionable drug arrest at Braxton Summit, a federal housing project. Community activist Grace Campbell recruits Siobhan Quays to work on behalf of Braxton and its residents, but their efforts are subverted as tensions flare between rival gangs.

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Lip has a million projects going on, and Frank is one of them; Liam is forced to watch Frank, so the two of them embark on a journey to take down Liam's classmate in an effort to get Liam into STEM school; Carl's disillusionment with the police force comes to a head; Debbie embraces the next chapter of her life and hunts for a new place; Mickey and Ian toy with the idea of the West Side; Kev meets Veronica in Louisville in a last-ditch effort to convince Carol not to move.

programme.title: Becky
programme.desc: After her mother's death, 13-year-old Becky goes on a weekend getaway with her father, Jeff, to bond and reconnect with him. Jeff, however, has a different plan—he brings along his new girlfriend Kayla in an attempt to bring her closer to Becky. However, when four newly-escaped prisoners show up and break into the lake house they are staying at, their plans change, and the fun trip becomes a nightmare. Becky now has to do everything she can to keep the three of them safe.

programme.title: True History of the Kelly Gang
programme.desc: Set in late 1800s Australia, True History of the Kelly Gang tells the story of Ned Kelly, the leader of one of the most prolific gangs Australia has ever seen. As a young child, Ned is exposed to poverty, familial strife, and oppression. His character is further developed when bushranger Harry Power enters the picture and teaches him how to despise authority. As Ned matures and descends into near-madness, people start to view him as either a hero or a murderer.

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: In this taut thriller, forensics expert Alex Cross investigates the disappearance of a senator's daughter, a student at a prestigious private academy.

programme.title: The Legend of Bagger Vance
programme.desc: Robert Redford directed this magical fable about a golfer (Matt Damon) who returns from WWI with post-traumatic stress disorder. He does get a chance to turn his life around, however, when he receives a visit from a mysterious caddy (Will Smith). Charlize Theron, Bruce McGill, Joel Gretsch, J. Michael Moncrief, Lane Smith.

programme.title: The Babe
programme.desc: A character study of baseball legend George Herman Ruth traces his career from his days as a youngster in an orphanage to his bittersweet bow out and explores the hidden vices—especially drinking—and dark corners of his private life.

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Stephenie Meyer's romantic and suspenseful best seller that started the phenomenon comes to life in this action-packed chronicle of the modern-day love story between a teenage girl and a vampire. Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson star. Billy Burke, Peter Facinelli, Elizabeth Reaser. Directed by Catherine Hardwicke.

programme.title: Legally Blonde
programme.desc: Reese Witherspoon is hilarious in this charmer about a ditzy L.A. sorority sister named Elle. She goes to Harvard Law School in an effort to win back her boyfriend and struggles to fit in among the snobs and intellectuals. But Elle soon discovers that she just might have what it takes to be a good lawyer. Luke Wilson, Selma Blair, Victor Garber, Holland Taylor.

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: The popular stage musical based on the songs of pop sensation ABBA comes to the screen in all its sing-along glory. A bride-to-be (Amanda Seyfried) in Greece attempts to solve the mystery of her paternity by reading the diary of her mother (Meryl Streep). Pierce Brosnan, Stellan Skarsgard and Colin Firth are the likeliest suspects. Christine Baranaski, Julie Walters, Dominic Cooper.

programme.title: Southside With You
programme.desc: Touching docudrama about Barack Obama's first date with Michelle Robinson, his future wife, during the summer of 1989 in Chicago.

programme.title: Air Force One
programme.desc: The President is held hostage on Air Force One by a crew of Russian terrorists. Using his strength and guile, the Commander-in-Chief must spring into action and fight off his attackers.

programme.title: 21 Bridges
programme.desc: A demoted NYPD detective secures an opportunity to redeem himself by taking the lead on a manhunt that encompasses the entire city. However, as he begins to uncover new clues, he learns of a plot that implicates his colleagues are in a crime ring. He will find that the tables have turned as he goes from predator to prey.

programme.title: City on a Hill
programme.desc: When an assistant U.S. attorney overdoses and ends up left for dead, Decourcy Ward suspects Jackie Rohr's involvement. Jackie, in turn, goes after the BPD for a questionable drug arrest at Braxton Summit, a federal housing project. Community activist Grace Campbell recruits Siobhan Quays to work on behalf of Braxton and its residents, but their efforts are subverted as tensions flare between rival gangs.

programme.title: Shameless

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: In this stunning crime drama set during the Great Depression, three rebellious brothers get into the bootlegging business and battle treachery on both sides of the law as they expand their operation into the big city.

programme.title: Legally Blonde
programme.desc: Reese Witherspoon is hilarious in this charmer about a ditzy L.A. sorority sister named Elle. She goes to Harvard Law School in an effort to win back her boyfriend and struggles to fit in among the snobs and intellectuals. But Elle soon discovers that she just might have what it takes to be a good lawyer. Luke Wilson, Selma Blair, Victor Garber, Holland Taylor.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: First entry in the action-thriller series that teamed Mel Gibson and Danny Glover as a seemingly psychotic cop and his common-sense family-man partner, respectively. In this outing, they investigate a woman's plunge from a high-rise and its connection to a drug cartel.

programme.title: Red
programme.desc: Retired CIA hit man Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) and his former colleagues race to find out why they've been targeted for death by their former organization and uncover a conspiracy implicating some prominent politicians in this rousing action comedy.

programme.title: Resistance
programme.desc: Amidst the Second World War, aspiring Jewish actor Marcel Mangel recruits a group of young Jewish Boy Scouts to work on behalf of the French Resistance to protect thousands of orphaned children as the brutal Nazi regime further encroaches upon their communities.

programme.title: Secret Window
programme.desc: Johnny Depp gives a virtuoso performance in this terrifying psycho-thriller based on the novella by Stephen King. Depp plays an author suffering from writer's block who becomes totally unhinged after he is accused of plagiarism by a menacing stranger (John Turturro).

programme.title: The Rental
programme.desc: Two young couples rent a scenic oceanside mansion for a celebratory weekend trip. The mood becomes increasingly unnerving as they begin to suspect that their Airbnb host is spying on them – and as the secrets that they have kept from each other begin to be revealed.

programme.title: Out of the Furnace
programme.desc: In this taut thriller, Rust Belt ex-con Russell is released from prison and must choose between escaping his life of poverty or saving his younger brother Rodney, who has fallen in with a dangerous crime ring.

programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: The Coen Brothers' Best Picture winner is a mesmerizing and violent crime opus set in 1980 West Texas, where a man finds and keeps a fortune in drug loot, then tries to dodge a sheriff and a bounty hunter attempting to recover it. Based on the Cormac McCarthy 2005 best seller. The film title is from a line in William Butler Yeats' poem \"Sailing to Byzantium.\".

programme.title: The Gentlemen
programme.desc: An American expat and self-made drug lord catalyzes a series of Machiavellian maneuvers by various players with a stake in London's underworld when he decides to sell his highly lucrative drug business, which involves cannabis farms hidden within the estates of aristocratic landlords.

programme.title: Top Gun
programme.desc: After losing his friend, an impetuous Navy pilot is accepted into Miramar's elite Fighter School. There, the pilot engages in a romance with his instructor while competing against a rival student flier for the program's coveted award.

programme.title: City on a Hill
programme.desc: When an assistant U.S. attorney overdoses and ends up left for dead, Decourcy Ward suspects Jackie Rohr's involvement. Jackie, in turn, goes after the BPD for a questionable drug arrest at Braxton Summit, a federal housing project. Community activist Grace Campbell recruits Siobhan Quays to work on behalf of Braxton and its residents, but their efforts are subverted as tensions flare between rival gangs.

programme.title: The Big Hit
programme.desc: Four expert hit men blast their way into a slave trader's stronghold, gaining the favor of a powerful mob boss. But when they kidnap a young heiress who happens to be the boss's goddaughter, they soon become targets themselves. A hard-hitting action-thriller executive produced by John Woo. Mark Wahlberg, Lou Diamond Phillips, Christina Applegate, Antonio Sabato Jr., Lela Rochon.

programme.title: Green Book
programme.desc: Bouncer Tony Lip is hired by African-American musician Don Shirley to chauffer him around the Jim Crow South in 1962 for an eight-week concert tour. The mismatched men form a friendship as Tony learns first-hand the racism Don must endure to perform.

programme.title: Richard Pryor Live on the Sunset Strip
programme.desc: Record of the comic's one-man show, taped at the Hollywood Palladium.

programme.title: XXX
programme.desc: While in jail, an extreme-sports enthusiast is blackmailed by a government agency to attempt to infiltrate a Russian crime ring that has access to biochemical weapons. An action-packed adrenaline rush.

programme.title: Top Gun
programme.desc: After losing his friend, an impetuous Navy pilot is accepted into Miramar's elite Fighter School. There, the pilot engages in a romance with his instructor while competing against a rival student flier for the program's coveted award.

programme.title: Gridiron Gang
programme.desc: In this inspirational sports drama based on a true story, a probation officer gives teenage delinquents a chance at redemption by starting a football team at a juvenile-detention camp.

During the First World War, two young British officers receive orders to venture deep behind enemy lines to deliver a critical message that could prevent the massacre of a British battalion in a trap laid by the enemy. At the bidding of their superior officers, the young privates put their own lives on the line, as it could mean the difference between life and death for 1,600 of their brothers in arms.

programme.title: Relic
programme.desc: When Kay learns that her aging and widowed mother, Edna, has vanished, she and her daughter Sam venture to Edna's remote home in search of the truth. The women soon sense an unsettling presence lurking in the house and possessing Edna, threatening to wreak havoc on the lives of Kay's family.

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: Guy Ritchie (\"Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels\") wrote and directed this darkly comic crime thriller about an unbelievably large diamond and the big and small-time thieves who try to get their hands on it, with varying degrees of incompetence. Benicio Del Toro, Dennis Farina, Brad Pitt, Jason Statham, Vinnie Jones, Alan Ford, Rade Sherbedgia.

programme.title: Limitless
programme.desc: Struggling author Eddie Morra (Bradley Cooper) overcomes his writer's block with a new drug that unlocks the full potential of his brain, and he forges a partnership with a powerful businessman (Robert De Niro) in this inventive, exciting thriller. Meanwhile, some dangerous characters discover Eddie's secret and come gunning for his dwindling supply of the pharmaceutical.

programme.title: Working Girl
programme.desc: A blue-collar secretary at a Wall Street investment bank sees her fortunes improve when her domineering boss is incapacitated with a broken leg, allowing her to push her own ideas forward and rise to the top of New York's banking circles.

programme.title: 28 Days
programme.desc: Sandra Bullock stars in this touching tale of a drunken writer's road to recovery. The alcohol-fueled antics of a woman (Bullock) cause an accident, and she's sentenced to a rehab clinic. The program's eccentric patients force her to reexamine her life. Viggo Mortensen.

programme.title: Legally Blonde
programme.desc: Reese Witherspoon is hilarious in this charmer about a ditzy L.A. sorority sister named Elle. She goes to Harvard Law School in an effort to win back her boyfriend and struggles to fit in among the snobs and intellectuals. But Elle soon discovers that she just might have what it takes to be a good lawyer. Luke Wilson, Selma Blair, Victor Garber, Holland Taylor.

programme.title: Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde
programme.desc: Reese Witherspoon shines as perpetually perky lawyer Elle Woods in this delightful sequel. When Elle discovers that her dog's mother is a victim of laboratory testing, she tries to persuade a congresswoman to back an animal-rights bill.

programme.title: VICE
programme.desc: Paola Ramos travels to El Darién along the Colombia-Panama border to meet with migrants facing robbery, rape and death on the road north; Krishna Andavolu investigates police-worn body camera functionality, usage, legislation and impact.

programme.title: XXX
programme.desc: While in jail, an extreme-sports enthusiast is blackmailed by a government agency to attempt to infiltrate a Russian crime ring that has access to biochemical weapons. An action-packed adrenaline rush.

programme.title: The Gentlemen
programme.desc: An American expat and self-made drug lord catalyzes a series of Machiavellian maneuvers by various players with a stake in London's underworld when he decides to sell his highly lucrative drug business, which involves cannabis farms hidden within the estates of aristocratic landlords.

programme.title: Dark Waters
programme.desc: Rob Bilott is a lawyer whose specialization is defending corporate entities. One day, a farmer named Wilbur Tennant barges into his office and blackmails him into helping him sue the Dupont company for poisoning the Dry Run Creek. Rob decides to check out the situation himself, and what he sees convinces him to take on the case. His boss, Tom Terp, is supportive of his endeavor to stop the company from causing any more harm to the environment, but his wife Sarah isn't as receptive.

programme.title: Pretty in Pink
programme.desc: Molly Ringwald is an underprivileged Cinderella choosing between two prom princes: a charming preppy and a disarming buddy.

programme.title: Grandma
programme.desc: In this biting comedy, an acerbic septuagenarian poet is drawn back into the lives of her workaholic daughter and teenage granddaughter when the latter asks for her help in dealing with an unplanned pregnancy.

programme.title: The Children Act
programme.desc: High Court judge Fiona Maye has to make a life-or-death decision for teenager Adam. Adam, who is almost 18 and legally a child, is refusing a vital blood transfusion that could keep him alive. A hospital visit greatly affects them both as Adam's fate lies in Fiona's hands.

programme.title: Inescapable
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, a Syrian expatriate living in Canada learns that his daughter has gone missing in Damascus, and he returns home for the first time in 20 years to find her with the help of an old flame and an official from the Canadian embassy.

programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: The Coen Brothers' Best Picture winner is a mesmerizing and violent crime opus set in 1980 West Texas, where a man finds and keeps a fortune in drug loot, then tries to dodge a sheriff and a bounty hunter attempting to recover it. Based on the Cormac McCarthy 2005 best seller. The film title is from a line in William Butler Yeats' poem \"Sailing to Byzantium.\".

programme.title: Made in Italy
programme.desc: Robert, a London-based bohemian artist, has been estranged from his adult son. They travel to Tuscany, Italy, to take care of business left to him by his late wife. He inherits a once beautiful villa, only to see it in a sorry state of disrepair. What turns out to be an initially quick trip becomes an extended stay as father and son try to repair the house, and in the process find their own way of trying to repair their strained relationship.

programme.title: Kiss the Girls
programme.desc: Strong performances and a taut script drive this pulse-pounding thriller about a forensic psychologist (Morgan Freeman) tracking an elusive serial killer. Helping him is a medical intern (Ashley Judd)---the only abductee to escape the killer's dungeon. Cary Elwes, Tony Goldwyn, Jay O. Sanders, Bill Nunn.

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: In this taut thriller, forensics expert Alex Cross investigates the disappearance of a senator's daughter, a student at a prestigious private academy.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
programme.desc: In this magical installment of the \"Twilight\" saga, Bella becomes pregnant after marrying Edward, which leads to a dangerous childbirth and a shocking realization for werewolf Jacob Black.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
programme.desc: The sweeping conclusion to the \"Twilight\" series follows Bella, Edward and Jacob as they band together to fight a group of ancient vampires who are threatening to destroy Bella and Edward's family.

programme.title: Becky
programme.desc: After her mother's death, 13-year-old Becky goes on a weekend getaway with her father, Jeff, to bond and reconnect with him. Jeff, however, has a different plan—he brings along his new girlfriend Kayla in an attempt to bring her closer to Becky. However, when four newly-escaped prisoners show up and break into the lake house they are staying at, their plans change, and the fun trip becomes a nightmare. Becky now has to do everything she can to keep the three of them safe.

programme.title: Erotic Uncoupling (?)
programme.desc: After years of marriage, Grace's husband Frank confesses to a two-year affair. He is leaving her for a woman he met at the office while he was \"working late.\" With no job and no skills, Grace's life is turned upside down. After landing a modest new job, Grace meets a young, vibrant, beautiful Sunny. Grace is enamored with Sunny. But, Grace struggles with old-school ideas of what a relationship is.

programme.title: Universal Soldier
programme.desc: Two U.S. soldiers killed in Vietnam—one a decent man and the other a genocidal maniac—are turned into robot assassins by a secret government program. However, the pair resume their deadly rivalry when their memories return in this thrilling action film.

programme.title: Urban Cowboy
programme.desc: Popular country-western take on \"Saturday Night Fever\" about a good ol' boy looking for love from atop a mechanical bull in a Houston honky-tonk. Based on a magazine article by Aaron Latham, who co-wrote the script.

programme.title: Uptown Girls
programme.desc: Brittany Murphy and young Dakota Fanning are delightful together in this charming comedy. Murphy plays the privileged daughter of a late rock star who loses her inheritance and must go to work as a nanny to a precocious 8-year-old.

programme.title: Eighth Grade
programme.desc: In this modern coming-of-age comedy, a shy and insecure thirteen-year-old girl's social life revolves around recording chirpy self-help YouTube videos in her bedroom. Unable to heed her own advice, she struggles to break out of her shell.

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Writer-director Andrew Dominik's thoughtful, elegiac saga is a dead-on throwback to classic Westerns of yore. Brad Pitt gives a bang-up performance as the notorious outlaw living out his final days in 1882 before being gunned down by a member of his gang (Casey Affleck). Features a cameo by political pundit James Carville as Governor Crittenden and rocker Nick Cave as a saloon singer. Cave also co-wrote the score. Actor-playwright Sam Shepard costars as Jesse's brother Frank.

programme.title: Saturday Night Fever
programme.desc: A working-class young man from Brooklyn is famous on the local disco scene, and has a complicated relationship with a fellow dancer who dreams of making it big in Manhattan.

programme.title: Cold Comes the Night
programme.desc: In this edge-of-your-seat thriller, a dangerous criminal takes a desperate hotel owner and her young daughter hostage in a last-ditch effort to retrieve a cache of money from a corrupt cop.

programme.title: Southside With You
programme.desc: Touching docudrama about Barack Obama's first date with Michelle Robinson, his future wife, during the summer of 1989 in Chicago.

programme.title: Rudy
programme.desc: A diminutive underdog is obsessed with joining Notre Dame's football team. Based on actual events.

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A disgraced basketball coach takes a job at a small Indiana high-school and leads the small squad on an improbable run for a state championship. Meanwhile, he helps the town drunk, a former basketball player, redeem himself.

programme.title: Gridiron Gang
programme.desc: In this inspirational sports drama based on a true story, a probation officer gives teenage delinquents a chance at redemption by starting a football team at a juvenile-detention camp.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: First entry in the action-thriller series that teamed Mel Gibson and Danny Glover as a seemingly psychotic cop and his common-sense family-man partner, respectively. In this outing, they investigate a woman's plunge from a high-rise and its connection to a drug cartel.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2
programme.desc: Two L.A. detectives—one a loose cannon, the other a cautious family man—face off with a vicious South African drug cartel that is operating under the cover of diplomatic immunity.

programme.title: Relic
programme.desc: When Kay learns that her aging and widowed mother, Edna, has vanished, she and her daughter Sam venture to Edna's remote home in search of the truth. The women soon sense an unsettling presence lurking in the house and possessing Edna, threatening to wreak havoc on the lives of Kay's family.

programme.title: Red
programme.desc: Retired CIA hit man Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) and his former colleagues race to find out why they've been targeted for death by their former organization and uncover a conspiracy implicating some prominent politicians in this rousing action comedy.

programme.title: Mystic Pizza
programme.desc: Three young women come of age amid romantic entanglements while working at a Connecticut pizzeria shortly after graduating from high school.

programme.title: While We're Young
programme.desc: In this scathing comedy-drama, a childless, fortysomething New York couple befriend two young hipsters. The older pair enjoy the idea of feeling young again, but their cross-generational friendship eventually sours.

programme.title: Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde
programme.desc: Reese Witherspoon shines as perpetually perky lawyer Elle Woods in this delightful sequel. When Elle discovers that her dog's mother is a victim of laboratory testing, she tries to persuade a congresswoman to back an animal-rights bill.

programme.title: How to Build a Girl
programme.desc: Johanna Morrigan is a smart, funny, and shameless 16-year-old who is set on improving her non-existent social life. One day, her brother Krissi directs her to an ad from a London-based rock magazine that is looking for a writer. Confident in her skills, she submits her review for the Annie soundtrack and as expected, the magazine writes back and she gets the job. Soon, she undergoes a makeover and starts calling herself Dolly Wilde.

programme.title: The Humanity Bureau
programme.desc: In a dystopian future oppressed by global warming, The Humanity Bureau investigates citizens and exiles those not meeting productivity standards. Agent Noah Kross meets a woman and her teenage son who is set for exile and works against his superiors to save him.

programme.title: Hereditary
programme.desc: When her mentally ill mother passes away, a woman named Annie and her husband, son and daughter all mourn her loss. The family turn to different means to handle their grief, including Annie and her daughter both flirting with the supernatural. They all begin to have disturbing, otherworldly experiences linked to the sinister secrets and emotional trauma that have been passed through the generations of their family.

programme.title: The Call
programme.desc: A 911 operator receives a call from a kidnapped girl who's been locked in the trunk of a car in this white-knuckle thriller. Now in order to rescue the girl, the terrified operator must confront a maniac who has killed before, and will certainly kill again if allowed to escape.

programme.title: Fantasy Island
programme.desc: A mysterious man invites several guests to his luxurious tropical island getaway, where he promises to make their fantasies come true. But they find themselves fighting for their lives and sanity when their wildest dreams become a nightmarish reality.

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is put on trial for murder; A new evidence connects Lauderback to Crosbie Wells.

programme.title: Men in Kilts: A Roadtrip with Sam and Graham
programme.sub-title: Scotland by Land, Air and Sea
programme.desc: Featuring Scotland's mountain ranges, rolling hills and shorelines.

programme.title: The Great Mother
programme.desc: Follows Nora Sandigo, legal guardian to over 2000 US-citizen children of undocumented immigrants, as she sacrifices everything to keep American-born children with their undocumented parents.

programme.title: The Last Shift
programme.desc: Middle-aged Stanley spends his days working at a local fast-food restaurant with his twenty-something coworker Jevon. When Stanley announces he will be leaving his job, his final shift at the restaurant unfolds in an unusual way that is beyond his comprehension.

programme.title: The Gloaming
programme.desc: Molly discovers a mysterious symbol that leads her to track down Freddie.

programme.title: Scary Movie 3
programme.desc: David Zucker, the man behind \"Airplane!\" directed this inspired spoof of horror movies with nods to \"Signs,\" \"The Ring,\" \"The Matrix Reloaded\" and even \"8 Mile.\".

programme.title: Alpha Dog
programme.desc: This gritty, highly intense fact-based crime drama tells the sordid tale of a group of drug dealers who kidnap the teenage brother (Anton Yelchin) of a client (Ben Foster) who owes them money and refuses to pay. At first the hostage is treated like their guest, but soon things spiral out of control and a pivotal decision about his fate must be reached. The outstanding young cast is led by Justin Timberlake, Emile Hirsch and Shawn Hatosy. Bruce Willis and Sharon Stone are also featured.

programme.title: Perfect Stranger
programme.desc: A reporter goes undercover to prove that a high-powered ad exec murdered her childhood friend. Halle Berry and Bruce Willis star in this suspenseful and twist-filled mystery. Giovanni Ribisi, Richard Portnow, Gary Dourdan, Florencia Lozano. Directed by James Foley.

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones star in this 1997 blockbuster, which is packed with dazzling special effects and razor-sharp wit. Jones plays Special Agent K, who recruits a New York cop (Smith) to help him protect the city from alien terrorists. The two begin by tracking a murderous extraterrestrial who has assumed the form of a farmer.

programme.title: Air
programme.desc: In this exciting thriller, a group of scientists and doctors retreat to an underground bunker after toxic air renders the world uninhabitable. When a fire breaks out in the facility, two engineers must race against time to save what's left of humanity.

programme.title: Juno
programme.desc: Best Actress nominee Ellen Page stars as a sassy teen who becomes pregnant after her first sexual encounter and decides to give up her baby to a well-off couple. A sharp and witty slice-of-life comedy that was up for Best Picture and Best Director (Jason Reitman). First-time screenwriter Diablo Cody won the Oscar for Best Original Screenplay. Michael Cera, J.K. Simmons.

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: The winner of 11 Academy Awards, this epic drama centers on the story of star-crossed lovers aboard the doomed luxury liner as it sails toward its tragic destiny in the icy waters of the North Atlantic.

programme.title: The Gloaming
programme.desc: Molly discovers a mysterious symbol that leads her to track down Freddie.

programme.title: Perfect Stranger
programme.desc: A reporter goes undercover to prove that a high-powered ad exec murdered her childhood friend. Halle Berry and Bruce Willis star in this suspenseful and twist-filled mystery. Giovanni Ribisi, Richard Portnow, Gary Dourdan, Florencia Lozano. Directed by James Foley.

programme.title: Alpha Dog
programme.desc: This gritty, highly intense fact-based crime drama tells the sordid tale of a group of drug dealers who kidnap the teenage brother (Anton Yelchin) of a client (Ben Foster) who owes them money and refuses to pay. At first the hostage is treated like their guest, but soon things spiral out of control and a pivotal decision about his fate must be reached. The outstanding young cast is led by Justin Timberlake, Emile Hirsch and Shawn Hatosy. Bruce Willis and Sharon Stone are also featured.

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Rock and Archie were once friends and partners-in-crime, but now Rock is a cop who intends to use Archie as an unwitting pawn in a scheme to bring down a powerful drug lord. Damon Wayans, Adam Sandler, James Caan, Jeep Swenson, James Farentino.

programme.title: Juno
programme.desc: Best Actress nominee Ellen Page stars as a sassy teen who becomes pregnant after her first sexual encounter and decides to give up her baby to a well-off couple. A sharp and witty slice-of-life comedy that was up for Best Picture and Best Director (Jason Reitman). First-time screenwriter Diablo Cody won the Oscar for Best Original Screenplay. Michael Cera, J.K. Simmons.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: In this teen drama-fantasy film, a bullied newcomer joins forces with three other high-school students to establish a culturally diverse coven of witches. As they make mischief and individually explore their newfound occult powers, they begin to realize that magic comes at a price.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: A fictionalized portrait of 13th-century Scottish rebel William Wallace, who led insurgents against oppressive English rule.

programme.title: The Devil Has a Name
programme.desc: When a stubborn local farmer's water supply suffers from poisoning, he levels his accusations at the matriarch of an oil dynasty with a lengthy history. Despite her instabilities, she resolves to push back against her opponent, all the while exposing the underbelly of the oil industry.

programme.title: The Legend of Zorro
programme.desc: The swashbuckling hero (Antonio Banderas) from 1998's \"The Mask of Zorro\" rides again in this ripping adventure set in 1850s California. Once again, Catherine Zeta-Jones costars and her on-screen chemistry with Banderas sizzles as they battle evil political forces that are trying to keep the territory from gaining statehood. The sequel is directed by Martin Campbell. Adrian Alonso portrays the young son of the now-married Don Alejandro (Banderas) and Elena (Zeta-Jones). Rufus Sewell.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: In this teen drama-fantasy film, a bullied newcomer joins forces with three other high-school students to establish a culturally diverse coven of witches. As they make mischief and individually explore their newfound occult powers, they begin to realize that magic comes at a price.

programme.title: Striking Distance
programme.desc: After being forced to testify against his own partner, a street cop finds himself demoted to the river-rescue patrol, where the same serial killer who haunted his former beat comes back to haunt him.

programme.title: Bad Boys for Life
programme.desc: Detective Marcus Burnett confesses to his partner Mike Lowrey his plans to retire after celebrating the birth of his new grandson, until Lowrey suffers a shooting. The investigators team up for one last mission in order to track down the suspected assassin and restore justice to their neighborhood.

programme.title: Take Me Home Tonight
programme.desc: In this hilarious and nostalgic comedy, aimless MIT graduate Matt Franklin (Topher Grace) sends out the '80s with a bang after being invited to an end-of-summer bash by Tori Frederking, his former high-school crush. Meanwhile, Matt's sarcastic twin sister Wendy urges him to get his life together, and his best friend Barry displays a wild streak the size of the Mississippi River.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: In this teen drama-fantasy film, a bullied newcomer joins forces with three other high-school students to establish a culturally diverse coven of witches. As they make mischief and individually explore their newfound occult powers, they begin to realize that magic comes at a price.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: A fictionalized portrait of 13th-century Scottish rebel William Wallace, who led insurgents against oppressive English rule.

Despite her instabilities, she resolves to push back against her opponent, all the while exposing the underbelly of the oil industry.

programme.title: Runaway Jury
programme.desc: In this suspenseful, well-plotted and beautifully acted legal thriller, an attorney who's brought a wrongful-death lawsuit against a gun manufacturer, a jury consultant working for the company, and a member of the jury cross paths. The film is based on a John Grisham bestseller.

programme.title: Men in Kilts: A Roadtrip with Sam and Graham
programme.sub-title: Scotland by Land, Air and Sea
programme.desc: Featuring Scotland's mountain ranges, rolling hills and shorelines.

programme.title: Hope Springs
programme.desc: In this deeply perceptive comedy-drama, a wife convinces her husband of 30 years to visit a marriage therapist in a small town called Great Hope Springs, and the couple work together to get over their sexual hang-ups and reinvigorate their relationship.

programme.title: Man of the House
programme.desc: There are lots of ha-ha's among the rah-rahs as Tommy Lee Jones stars as a no-nonsense Texas Ranger assigned to watch over a bevy of beautiful college cheerleaders who witnessed a murder. Kelli Garner, Monica Keena, Christina Milian, Paula Garces and Vanessa Ferlito play the peppy students. Cedric the Entertainer, Anne Archer, Shannon Marie Woodward, Brian Van Holt, R. Lee Ermey, Curtis Armstrong, Paget Brewster.

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: In this Oscar-winning love story set in 1593 England, struggling playwright William Shakespeare (Joseph Fiennes) is inspired by the lovely Viola de Lesseps (Oscar winner Gwyneth Paltrow). The two begin a secret affair---despite her engagement to another man. Geoffrey Rush, Ben Affleck.

programme.title: Bloodshot
programme.desc: This adaptation of the 1990s Valiant Comics character revolves around Ray Garrison, a resurrected soldier armed with the power of nanotechnology. After regaining memories of his former life, he rebels against the scientists who created him to pursue the man who killed him.

programme.title: Hope Springs
programme.desc: In this deeply perceptive comedy-drama, a wife convinces her husband of 30 years to visit a marriage therapist in a small town called Great Hope Springs, and the couple work together to get over their sexual hang-ups and reinvigorate their relationship.

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is put on trial for murder; A new evidence connects Lauderback to Crosbie Wells.

programme.title: End of Watch
programme.desc: In this explosive found-footage crime drama, two young LAPD officers tangle with a Latino street gang and a Mexican drug cartel after they are reassigned to an inner-city beat following a fatal shooting.

programme.title: Step Up: High Water
programme.desc: Dondre and Janelle struggle to conceal their affection for each other. Connections at High Water are under pressure from consistent changes.

programme.title: The Siege
programme.desc: Denzel Washington is excellent in this charged thriller as a federal agent investigating a terrorist group that's responsible for a number of bombings in New York City, which is placed under martial law when the culprits evade capture, with an autocratic general (Bruce Willis) in command. Annette Bening, Tony Shalhoub.

programme.title: Something's Gotta Give
programme.desc: Jack Nicholson and Diane Keaton are dynamic in this witty romantic comedy. Nicholson plays an aging Lothario with a young girlfriend. He meets his soul mate, however, when he's introduced to his lover's mother, a playwright who can't stand the sight of him.

programme.title: Lake Placid
programme.desc: When people begin to disappear at a secluded lake in the Maine wilderness in this pulse-pounding thriller, an investigative team discovers that a ferocious giant crocodile is the culprit.

programme.title: Brightburn
programme.desc: After an alien boy arrives on Earth and is adopted by a local couple, he lives in a rural farming area with them, showing amazing abilities and talents early on in life. But once he is bullied at school, the boy is sent on an evil path of retribution in this horror film based on the premise of Superman gone wrong.

programme.title: Here Comes the Boom
programme.desc: In this riotous comedy, an earnest high-school biology teacher and one-time collegiate wrestler becomes a mixed-martial-arts fighter in order to resuscitate his school's failing music program, and discovers a newfound sense of confidence in the process.

programme.title: Godzilla (?)
programme.desc: A scientist teams with a mysterious French agent to try to stop a massive, radioactive lizard from destroying Manhattan.

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Angelina Jolie stars as sexy Lara Croft in this high-tech action fantasy, based on the popular video game. The aristocratic adventuress battles a villainous secret society as she races to recover an ancient artifact with magic powers. Jolie's real-life father, Jon Voight, costars as Lara's dad, Lord Richard Croft. Iain Glen, Daniel Craig, Noah Taylor.

programme.desc: A singer receives a devastating brain tumor diagnosis a day before an important performance at New York's Birdland Jazz Club. Instead of sharing her diagnosis with her mother, her manager, or an old friend, she decides to face her mortality alone.

Jones, Kathleen Wilhoite, David Lindstedt, Mark Kiely, Gordon Tootoosis.

programme.title: The Exorcism of Emily Rose
programme.desc: This potent and powerful meld of courtroom drama and shocking horror details the case of a priest who is charged with negligent homicide when a possessed 19-year-old dies during an exorcism.

programme.title: SEAL Team Six: The Raid on Osama bin Laden
programme.desc: A dramatization of the raid that resulted in the May 2, 2011, killing of Al Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden.

programme.title: Heat
programme.desc: A successful career criminal considers getting out of the business after one last score with his crew, while an obsessive cop desperately tries to put him behind bars. The memorable \"cafe scene\" marks the first time Al Pacino and Robert De Niro have appeared on-screen together.

programme.title: Robin Hood
programme.desc: Virtuous outlaw Robin Hood (Russell Crowe) and his band of spirited allies fight corruption in 13th-century England and battle a tyrannical sheriff who has assumed control of Nottingham in director Ridley Scott's dazzling tale of adventure. As Robin and his men rise to the status of folk heroes, the noble warrior finds himself falling for the lovely Lady Marion.

programme.desc: A callous Navy SEAL is charged with rescuing a doctor during a humanitarian mission in war-torn Nigeria. There's only one problem: She doesn't want to leave her patients behind.
