programme.title: Radio
programme.desc: Cuba Gooding Jr. is inspiring in this heartwarming, fact-based drama. Gooding plays \"Radio\" Kennedy, a mentally handicapped man who is brought out of his shell by a football coach (Ed Harris) who gets him involved with the high school and the team. Mike Tollin, the man behind \"Varsity Blues\" and \"Summer Catch,\" directed. The script is based on a Sports Illustrated article.

programme.title: Frankie
programme.desc: Over the course of 24 hours, a single family's three generations cope with an unexpected and impactful event while on holiday in the whimsical and scenic town of Sintra, Portugal. The event affects each member of the family in different ways and irrevocably alters the course of their lives.

programme.title: Man About Town
programme.desc: Ben Affleck stars in this biting satire about a top Hollywood agent whose perfect life comes crashing down when he learns that his beautiful wife (Rebecca Romijn) is cheating on him and his private journal is stolen by a vengeful, would-be screenwriter. John Cleese, Samuel Ball, Gina Gershon, Mike Binder (who also wrote and directed).

programme.title: Dark Tide (?)
programme.desc: Terror runs deep when a renowned shark expert attempts to recover from a tragic diving mishap by taking a wealthy businessman swimming with the deep sea-predators, only to get stranded in a dangerous feeding ground known as \"Shark Alley.\".

programme.title: John Grisham's 'The Rainmaker'
programme.desc: In this gripping adaptation, a naive young lawyer and his experienced partner take on a corrupt insurance company in the court case of a lifetime.

programme.title: Frankie
programme.desc: Over the course of 24 hours, a single family's three generations cope with an unexpected and impactful event while on holiday in the whimsical and scenic town of Sintra, Portugal. The event affects each member of the family in different ways and irrevocably alters the course of their lives.

programme.title: The Cave
programme.desc: A frightening confluence of \"Alien,\" \"Jaws\" and \"The Deep\" follows a first-rate team of divers and their ghastly encounters with the ferocious creatures who inhabit the watery caverns under a 13th-century church in Romania. Cole Hauser stars as the head diver, with Eddie Cibrian as his brother and Morris Chestnut, Rick Ravanello, Kieran Darcy-Smith and Piper Perabo rounding out the squad. Marcel Iures, Lena Headey. Directed by Bruce Hunt and featuring excellent underwater footage by Wes Skiles.

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's docudrama about paralyzed Vietnam vet Ron Kovic, who tries to reconcile memories of his idealistic youth with his post-war disillusionment.

programme.title: The Current War: Director's Cut (?)
programme.desc: Electricity kingpins George Westinghouse and Thomas Edison find their rivalry escalating, plunging deeper into a brutal race to electrify the United States. Loyalties are tested and lines are crossed as the magnates vie to exert their influence across the nation and also bring their patented electrical system to the entire modern world.

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Rob Brown gives a stellar performance in this winning fact-based sports biopic. He plays Syracuse University running back Ernie Davis, the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy as the outstanding college-football player in the nation in 1961. Dennis Quaid costars as Syracuse coach Ben Schwartzwalder. Directed by Gary Fleder. The screenplay is by Charles Leavitt, who based it on the book \"Ernie Davis: The Elmira Express,\" written by Syracuse alumnus Robert C. Gallagher.

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: Racial tensions grow in a Brooklyn neighborhood on the hottest day of the summer while everyone tries to cope with the heat. Spike Lee received an Oscar nomination for his screenplay.

programme.title: The Original Kings of Comedy
programme.desc: Comedians Steve Harvey, D.L. Hughley, Cedric the Entertainer and Bernie Mac bring down the house in this outrageous concert film. Director Spike Lee captures the geniuses behind the \"Kings of Comedy\" tour as they perform in Charlotte, N.C. in February 2000.

programme.title: The Queens of Comedy (?)
programme.desc: Comedians Miss Laura Hayes, Adele Givens, Sommore and Mo'Nique bring down the house with a quartet of saucy stand-up routines. Among the highlights: Sommore says she would like to see men come with a side-effects warning label, and \"big, ol' healthy girl\" Mo'Nique tells why skinny women are evil: \"They're always hungry.\".

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: The comic and star of film and television fires on all cylinders in this stand-up performance at Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C. Playfully profane innuendo and graphic gestures abound as Lawrence riffs on sex, love, race, drugs and family life, and even reflects on his legal and health troubles.

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: Twenty-five years after testifying against her brother as the person responsible for killing their family, a haunted woman decides to reopen the case when she is approached by a secret society of amateur criminologists. A skin-crawling mystery.

programme.title: The Current War: Director's Cut (?)
programme.desc: Electricity kingpins George Westinghouse and Thomas Edison find their rivalry escalating, plunging deeper into a brutal race to electrify the United States. Loyalties are tested and lines are crossed as the magnates vie to exert their influence across the nation and also bring their patented electrical system to the entire modern world.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: A former Green Beret wages a one-man war against police and the National Guard in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Little Fockers
programme.desc: In this hilarious sequel, Greg butts heads with his father-in-law when he is forced to work a second job to support his family, which leads to a series of wild misunderstandings at a birthday party for his children.

programme.title: Tommy Boy
programme.desc: A boisterous bumbler vows to save his late father's auto-parts business with the aid of a prissy company man.

programme.title: Ophelia
programme.desc: Ophelia, a rebellious young woman, is taken in by the Queen of Denmark, Gertrude, to be one of her ladies-in-waiting. Through the years, she becomes one of the Queen's most favored, and when Hamlet, the Queen's son, comes back home from studying, they eventually fall in love. As a power struggle arises in the castle, Ophelia needs to make a hard decision -- her love or her life.

programme.title: Enduring Love
programme.desc: In a haunting exploration of obsession, a university professor (Daniel Craig) finds himself being stalked by a religious fanatic he met during a bizarre hot-air balloon accident. Roger Michell (\"Changing Lanes\") directed this gripping thriller. Rhys Ifans, Samantha Morton, Bill Nighy, Susan Lynch.

programme.title: The Caveman's Valentine
programme.desc: Samuel L. Jackson wears several hats in this tense drama about a Juilliard-trained pianist who suffers from schizophrenia and lives in a cave. He suspects that a young homeless man's death was actually a murder, but can't get anyone to believe him. Ann Magnuson, Colm Feore, Aunjanue Ellis, Tamara Tunie, Jay Rodan, Anthony Michael Hall.

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: A gifted classical musician struggles to survive in the Warsaw ghetto during the Holocaust in this harrowing look at Nazi brutality and one man's fight for survival.

programme.title: The Untouchables
programme.desc: A Prohibition crime thriller about the battle between gangster Al Capone and federal agent Eliot Ness. Ness and his team of do-gooders set out on a mission to put crime lord Capone out of business.

programme.title: A Most Violent Year
programme.desc: In this gripping and stylish drama, an immigrant businessman defends his expanding NYC empire against violence and corruption during the turbulent winter of 1981.

programme.title: Mob Town
programme.desc: In 1957, an FBI agent teams up with a local police officer to monitor the activities of New York City's most notorious Mafia leaders as they prepare for a large-scale gathering in upstate New York. It is up to the unlikely duo to piece together the purpose of such a meeting and thwart any instances of violence that may erupt as a result.

programme.title: Son of a Gun
programme.desc: An incarcerated teen befriends a notorious criminal, and together they stage a daring prison break in this thrilling crime drama. Once free, the duo plot an audacious series of heists as their enemies close in.

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The powerful true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus.

programme.title: Little Fockers
programme.desc: In this hilarious sequel, Greg butts heads with his father-in-law when he is forced to work a second job to support his family, which leads to a series of wild misunderstandings at a birthday party for his children.

programme.title: On the Basis of Sex
programme.desc: Young wife, mother and lawyer Ruth Bader Ginsburg battles the U.S. Supreme Court for gender equality and women's rights. She works with the American Civil Liberties Union to argue cases on behalf of both men and women, demonstrating that discrimination \"on the basis of sex\" is unconstitutional. Her trailblazing work paved the way for her to become a beloved Supreme Court Justice.

programme.title: The Sea of Trees
programme.desc: In this haunting drama, a depressed American businessman makes a pilgrimage to Aokigahara, Japan's notorious \"Sucide Forest,\" with intentions to kill himself. But a chance encounter with a badly injured Japanese man awakens the desire to live within both of them. As they partner together to struggle their way out of the dense forest, they slowly open up about the traumas that brought them there.

programme.title: The Lobster
programme.desc: In this wonderfully unique romance set in a dystopian future, a man is sent to a hotel for single adults in order to find a new partner after his wife leaves him. If he fails to do so within 45 days, he will be turned into an animal of his choosing.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: A male nurse (Ben Stiller) visits his girlfriend's family with the intent of asking her dad (Robert De Niro) for her hand in marriage. Not so easy. Her father turns out to be a very protective, very intimidating, very suspicious ex-CIA agent. Blythe Danner, Teri Polo, Owen Wilson.

programme.title: Pretty in Pink
programme.desc: Molly Ringwald is an underprivileged Cinderella choosing between two prom princes: a charming preppy and a disarming buddy.

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally...
programme.desc: A couple of recent college grads who are opposites go their separate ways. However, as they repeatedly run into each other over the years, they are able to maintain a close friendship by keeping sex out of it for fear it might ruin their relationship.

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: An irresponsible, commitment-phobic bachelor overcomes his overgrown-adolescent ways when he befriends the awkward son of a troubled single mother in this charming adaptation of the novel by Nick Hornby (\"High Fidelity\").

programme.title: Waves
programme.desc: A suburban African-American family living in South Florida cope with life, love, and unexpected calamity. Their ambitions for happiness and success are thwarted by a career-ending sports injury and the traumatic aftermath of an unintended murder.

programme.title: Jexi
programme.desc: Phil, who has an obsession with his phone, gets an upgraded model that integrates a virtual voice assistant named Jexi. Phil's life begins to change when Jexi encourages him to go out more and make friends. But as Phil becomes less obsessed with his phone, Jexi starts to make his life miserable.

programme.title: The Spectacular Now
programme.desc: In this poignant, witty look at coming of age, a smooth-talking high-school senior falls for a straight-arrow good girl and finds adjusting to more of an adult life more complicated than he expected.

programme.title: How to Talk to Girls at Parties
programme.desc: Punk teen Enn attempts to crash a party in the London suburbs. He ends up at the wrong house where he encounters a kooky, conformist cult, which includes the naive Zan. They hit it off before Enn learns that she is actually a repressed alien on Earth to complete a fatal ritual. Enn appeals to the punk scene to help both emotionally and physically liberate the lady he's fallen for.

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers 2
programme.desc: Victor Salva's clever direction guides this frightening thriller about a gruesome reptilian creature that preys on humans every 23 years for 23 days. This time, it is trained on a busload of high-school athletes, who are traveling on a remote highway.

programme.title: The Sea of Trees
programme.desc: In this haunting drama, a depressed American businessman makes a pilgrimage to Aokigahara, Japan's notorious \"Sucide Forest,\" with intentions to kill himself. But a chance encounter with a badly injured Japanese man awakens the desire to live within both of them. As they partner together to struggle their way out of the dense forest, they slowly open up about the traumas that brought them there.

programme.title: Rafiki
programme.desc: As a local election looms ahead in Nairobi, Kenya, two daughters of rival aspiring politicians fall in love with one another. In a country where homosexuality is illegal, their romance can only survive when it is kept a secret from everyone around them.

programme.title: When We Were Kings
programme.desc: Twenty-three years in the making, Leon Gast's documentary covers the legendary 1974 \"Rumble in the Jungle\" between Muhammad Ali and George Foreman that was promoted by Don King and financed by the president of Zaire. The controversial events leading up to and following the historic heavyweight bout are examined in detail.

programme.title: Volition
programme.desc: James has lived his entire life with an unusual ability of foresight and, as he ages, he struggles to cope with his powers of clairvoyance. Yet when he experiences an unsettling insight into his own murder, he strives to change the future in his present.

programme.title: Tammy's Always Dying
programme.desc: Catherine is beginning to grow tired of caring for her alcoholic mother, Tammy, who is such a bundle of energy when drunk. However, when she is sober, Tammy is a scathing mother who doesn't have anything good to say about her daughter. Things suddenly change when Tammy is diagnosed with cancer, and Catherine is forced to go back to their house and live with her mother.

programme.title: XXX
programme.desc: While in jail, an extreme-sports enthusiast is blackmailed by a government agency to attempt to infiltrate a Russian crime ring that has access to biochemical weapons. An action-packed adrenaline rush.

programme.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
programme.desc: This epic won an Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film and became the highest-grossing foreign movie of all time when it was released. Hong Kong superstar Chow Yun-Fat plays a warrior in ancient China who is trying to retrieve a stolen magical sword. Director Ang Lee's characters soar through the air as he combines gravity-defying action scenes with a sweet love story. Michelle Yeoh.
